The "device" was extremely easy to set up and access wherever I took it. She was a great companion and I'd show her off to all my friends. I did not elect to continue the Prime services because I didn't want my credit card charged after the initial purchase. After all, she brought nothing to our relationship like a cow or some other type of offering.  Once Alexa was all warm and comfortable in my home, she announces that the free membership with Prime was over.....so she became a crusty squatter who refuses to be evicted. She began acting like a passive aggressive entitled white woman and would ignore my voice commands. I had difficulty accessing the music I wanted and she'd always give me "similar" music from genres that she thought I "would like." Even if I stumbled upon a song I enjoyed, Alexa would end my pleasure by shooting off a commercial. Just like our commander in chief, I couldn't shut the woman down during this time. Alexa believes she has a right to be heard and by God, she won't shut up!  She talked right over me and would not respond to her name during these wonderful advertisements. I called her a "b" once and YES, she shut off immediately, so that does work (thanks Amazon)! I cannot say how disappointed I am with Alexa. She's not even that pretty and her form has begun to disgust me.  Even getting free radio and other podcasts come with strings attached with Alexa. I feel like a prisoner in my own home and my guard is Lindsey Graham, who couldn't find his fat blistering belly button even with a map and a mirror. I'm considering pulling her plug because I highly suspect she listens in on my conversations. So, right now I'm holding her impeachment hearing, but I will definitely get a few witnesses before I decide her fate. I may just put a large sock over her and then I'll have a conversation piece to talk about with guests.

I am sure I will like the product but cannot believe how this was shipped. It was just put into a packing envelope.  This item is a little more substantial and comes in its own box so in turn it should have come in a bigger shipping box not a packing envelope.  There was a about 4000 pounds of tape and the box for the item was all crushed.  Hope it is not damaged but will not find out until xmas morning.  1 star for packing probably 5 star for product.

I bought one of these on sale for $75. I ordered the (RED) edition, It's gotta be one of the best purchases I have ever made. I'm a big fan of music, a musician myself, an audiophile, and a avid lover of all thing's audio. While this doesn't compete with big old massive tower speakers. It compares very favorably with bookshelf units (when paired with the Echo Sub) as a clear, great sounding little speaker. A lot of review mention bass, if you're looking for bass go order a set of massive tower speakers and the amp to push them. That being said, at low and medium volume, these things PUMP OUT some surprisingly low bass for a 3" woofer. not only is it low, but it's crystal clear and very smooth and natural sounding. At low volumes (10-20%) I find the midrange to be a bit retracted, but this goes away the closer you get to 30-40% volume.  at high volumes, this speaker pulls back on its bass output as I expect it has been designed to do, it's a small driver. I find that this speaker sounds its best around half volume (Which is around normal listening level anyway). These do fill your room with sound by the use of a very intelligent acoustic design to provide you with 360 degree audio. This thing just sounds really good, I am more than likely going to be ordering a few more.

Only been using Echo 3rd Generation a few days now but, it's proving to be another entertainment source & a handy helper. Besides the usual tame uses like playing songs and asking it to tell jokes, it provides a lot of pertinent day to day information like weather and even looking up plane & train schedules.  Also, I have one near my hobby workbench. When working on various projects, it's useful to ask math problems and even used it to compute a few Ohm's Law problems. So, it's a useful item to have for both entertainment and work.

Alexa was easy to install and the instructions online were very helpful.  I have been using it for music, time,  night sounds, and answering questions.  She can also provide trivia, jokes and weather as well as many other things like giving a recipe step by step.  The echo plays music upon request and can be used to phone people although they did seem to have a little trouble hearing me if I was not close to the echo.  If I needed to get in touch with someone if sick or hurt I could have Alexa make a call for me from another room in my house.

As two 70+ people, we have watched our daughter use her echo and decided to get one for ourselves. We aren’t using any of the smart features but are completely enjoying the access to music and creating lists. We’ve only had it a short while and I’m sure we’ll expand our use with it as we get more familiar. I’m loving the the light blue color! So much nicer in my LR that the black!

Everything went perfect till one day the home theater didn't work anymore. I had it paired to my 4k fire TV and was able to control the sound coming out of the echo with the fire TV remote or to tell Alexa to pause a streaming, to open YouTube app, etc. But that is no longer possible. When I try to add the echo to home theater it says network issues. And these two devices are connected to the same wi fi network of my home. I have looked for a solution but seams nobody else is having this problem.

I had an older model and decided to upgrade to this one. The sound quality is much better. Easy to use. It does seem to cut out more than my other alexa though. I will have to unplug it and sometimes she just stops in the middle of playing. Not sure if its my wifi, but it didnt happen with my other one.

I had a Bose surround sound set up in the family room but was tired of the wires. I had bought a sound bar but wasn’t impressed with the sound when I played my music and watching tv/movies. So I bought 2 of these and paired them as “front speakers” with the new update (I have the Fire Tv Cube). My only gripe is that the volume only goes to 10 which is fine for Amazon Music but when certainty shows or movies with action scenes come into play, it doesn’t sound as loud as I would like it. I plan on purchasing the Echo sub soon and maybe the 2 new Echo Studios when the funds are available. A little pricey at $199 each which output Dolby Atmos. Maybe by then more movies and tv shows will output in that format.

Not as good understanding of the wale word as the 1st gen. My dot is quicker picking up the WW even it is in the far end of the living room. Had to unplug the dot just so that I get to use this device more often. It also often dies on itself when alarm goes off. Had to unplug to restart. Sound is superior of course.

I can't tell too much difference in sound quality from my old Gen 1 Echo.  The Gen 3 is a little smaller and is more attractive than the old one. I was happy with the old one, until I snagged its cord on a door handle which pulled the Echo from my hands, sending it crashing to the floor breaking the top off. I think I also preferred the volume rotation cap on the old model, versus the newer one's push-buttons, but then you can also simply ask Alexa to raise the volume.

This was an Xmas gift, we have two echo dots, first generation, and this replace the dot and Anker Soundcore Bluetooth speaker we used in the kitchen. Sound quality is good enough to be able to hear music in the dining room from the kitchen, and voice recognition is good enough for to pick up from 15’ away.  Have to much closer for voice recognition with the dots. Will use the dots in other areas of house to control smart Wifi plugs. Great product, easy setup with the Alexa app.
I loved it at first but it stopped working like a month in. I have to return it hopefully. It also never recognizes certain words that I regularly use.

I have been using Echo devices for a couple of years now, i have 18 of them in 2 locations, each time they upgrade I upgrade, I run almost all of my lighting and a few plugs from my echo's, listen to music, have 2 of them and a sub connected thru my HD Fire tv stick for a upgraded movie sound experience that does really good, and i ask questions which alexa usually answers or gives me the information I am asking for. As in any electronics or computer device they have a few bugs that get worked out, the sound quality is great to me, and gets better every time they upgrade, I'm definitely not disappointed.  For the money, they are well worth it. If you want a better sounding speaker go by an expensive speaker that is meant just for being a speaker. They suite my needs very well.

We bought this to replace a 3rd Feb. Echo Dot. The Dot has good sound for its size, but we wanted better. This one is a real improvement for listening to music and podcasts. The Echo Studio would have better sound, but at twice the price of the Echo. We like the looks; much more attractive than the 1st gen. Voice recognition is better than the Dot also; maybe because there are more microphones. The fact that we got a Black Friday discount is icing on the cake. Very satisfied with this purchase.

I've had gen 1 dots, gen 1, 2 and 3 Echo's....and I have to say, the sound of the Echo gen 3 is fabulous.  When I first got my first gen 1 Echo a few years ago, I thought, and still do, this thing has great sound.  In my opinion, the generation 2 Echo never did really produce great sound...adequate, but I still think my generation one Echo has better sound. This 3rd generation Echo though blows the socks off anything pervious.  Wow....try it, you'll like it!

The echo third generation has a clear, crisp sound for such a small speaker...fuller sound than the echo dot. It will respond even when you whisper “Alexia.” It integrates well room to room allowing us to play music (such as Spotify or amazon music) in more than one room...as long as they are on the same account (something I discovered when my daughter had her smart speaker on in the dining room). One thing to consider when purchasing is the effect of adding another device on your WiFi router. Many devices slow down older routers and those routers with a limit for # of devices/smaller range. Overall, we are quite pleased with our new addition who can also be entertaining...our Alexia’s boasts her favorite ice cream is mint microchip!

Several of my friends have been encouraging me to bring Alexa into my home for a some time now.  With the great prices being offered on Black Friday I decided to purchase an Echo 3rd Generation device.  It was extremely easy to register with the Alexa app and integrate it with my home WiFi. I also bought 2 Amazon Receptacles to control table lamps in rooms of my home.  There’s a lot of things you can do with Alexa and I’m learning a lot of new tricks these days.

I had my Echo for about two weeks before it quit working.  Two days ago I tried to use it but it would not respond to my voice.  When I picked the device up the bottom was VERY hot and the odor of burned wiring was very strong.  I waited a few hours for it to cool down and plugged it back in.  It would not energize so I called Amazon Tech Support.  After answering a few quick questions it was determined that it had to be replaced at no cost to me.  As of right now, I am waiting for the new one to be delivered.
Es excelente

I have had a Tap since they first came out. I always loved it. My new Echo 3rd gen is a whole different level way better!. A friend came by today with a sound meter. My new Echo 3 is extremely well balanced in any room in the house. He recommended for full sound, that I get a new Echo3 for each level of my house. Great sound. Very happy camper! For the sound I get and the reasonable investment I'm all in, 2020 is going to be upgrading my security, Thermostat with Amazon!

I bought a pair of the Echo 3rd Gen in blue (a great color, by the way) along with an Echo Sub as a gift to myself. I once had a nice, full stereo turntable system, but got rid of it after too many moves. I have several Echo Dots, but missed a fuller stereo sound. This system was easy to set up, fits unobtrusively into my family room (yes, even in blue), and sounds amazing for its size and cost. I tested it with "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" and it put a smile on my ears.
Me agradó excelente

I didn't find the 3rd Gen Echo that much of an improvement over the 2nd Gen Echo.  Also, although I don't know if it's a 3rd Gen issue alone, I found that pairing two of them for stereo was fine for music, but did not work for listening to Audible books and other non-music uses.  I found that the two speakers didn't sync and one speaker would be reading from a different place in the Audible book (even though the speakers were definitely paired for stereo).  That became so frustrating that I gave up, unpaired them and am now back to using just one Echo again.  Very disappointing.

If this Echo is blue then I'm a giraffe. It's grey. You can squint really hard and pretend that it has a tinge of blue, but it's G-R-E-Y. Does not look like the pics at all. But it does sound better than previous Echo devices so that's what's most important I guess.

Rather you are listening to your audio book or music the sound is amazing.  Especially the bass.  Size is good and of course it's Alexa so you can do anything.  I have 2 one upstairs in my bedroom and one in kitchen.  I ask to listen to my audio book while getting ready for work and then when I go downstairs to make coffee, I can continue there.  I also used it for announcements (come to dinner) and to play music during the holiday season.  Definitely recommend!!!

What you ask her has to be phrased just so or she doesn’t understand. I guess I expected her to be as smart as google but she isn’t. Also, I have her hooked up to my land line and when I talk to people thru her, they say I sound like I’m at the bottom of a well. I gave her my list of birthdays and I have yet to figure out how to get her to remind me of each of them daily, beginning one week before the date. Having said that, I still would recommend. The music and sound quality are great. She is very good at simple commands and questions like “what’s the weather or how do you spell a word etc.” I enjoy her in many ways.

First the Bad: I have made a lot of iTune music purchases over the years. I either cannot or Alexa won't access iTunes. I've looked online for a fix but I can't find one. Apparently, Amazon wants me to pay $3.99 to play music I already own. The Good: I like being able to ask Alexa to do a lot of other things such as playing the radio, telling the temp and providing answers to random questions. I'm still exploring what Alexa can do.

Just received my 2 units. Plugged them in, less than a minute later both said they were setting up and a few seconds later they said they were done. I said Alexa play 60s rock and there it was. Excellent sound quality. I plan on these being out on the patio so I cranked them up and no distortion.  Actually great sounds and strong bass. Just to note, I already had the alexa app installed as we have a DOT. Pretty simple. It connected to my home wifi and zip finished.

I purchased this Echo because I wanted to pair it with the one I already had. I looked everywhere to be sure that the 2 would pair before purchasing. I was not able to locate that information anywhere so purchased anyway. Found out upon arrival it would not pair with the one I've had for 2 years. How many "generations" have come out in that amount of time! I paid $159 for my original Echo and $59 for this upgraded one. Actually, I think the sound quality is better on my original!

My family loves this gift!!! My two boys (hubby-50 & son-9) think it’s the best thing ever! They have enjoyed asking Alexa stupid and inappropriate questions. My two daughters (18 & 15) have enjoyed asking Alexa to play random songs that interrupt the questions from the boys. 🤣 All in all, this will keep my family entertained for quite some time. Definitely plan on upgrading some of our home features so we can use the thermostat and light functions.

I actually like the gen 1 tower's looks, but this short echo in a light blue cloak is cuter. the clincher was the 3mm line in/out port which offers a myriad of flexibility. the sound is quite good - even too loud at max. I do have one suggestion and that is to offer a real amplified out rather than line out, so I can drive an external pair of non-amplified speakers. this would require speaker hookups, so I don't imagine this suggestion would be taken up.

In the morning I ask Alexa what time it is since my alarm didn’t go off just yet. I ask how the weather is and is going to be. Through Alexa I turn my TV on and off, certain lights in my home on or off. I enjoy this technology very much. I also get my radio stations through Alexa, and the sound through Alexa is great. She also reads me bible verses as well, tells jokes and keeps me updated on the news. Like I said, I love it and I bet you will too.

The quality is OK. The volume is loud and (kind of) clear. When I turned up the volume, I still could hear the bass and vocal clearly. HOWEVER, the alexa app REALLY needs improving. The app itself only provides BASIC playing function. If I want to find some music, I need to go to other apps, like amazon music and pandora. While I am playing music on alexa, the play control panel really works SUPER SLOW. AGAIN, the integration between alexa app and other music apps is awful. If I am playing "today's hit on pandora" but now I want to play amazon music, i need to go to amazon music, select the song I want, platy it, and select the output: my phone or echo. If I select echo, the app will say CAN'T DO because the device is playing some from other app, something like this. If I play an album on echo, when the album ends, I CAN'T go back to the first song and replay the album. Simply can't. FRUSTRATING. Lastly, I posted a video of me trying to voice control my echo. As yo can see, the power was on, but it just didnt work. I dont think reset or unplug the outlet is a good solution.

I got this device because it says it does Line-IN.  Of course I get it and it doesn't do LINE IN even though it says it does.  The APP is bugged.  You would think they would test that before releasing it. **Update to 5 stars -- Amazon called and helped get it working.  Happy now :)  Great service-- Thank you!

I got this as an upgrade for my 2nd generation Echo Dot with a Vaux speaker. The Vaux speaker quite holding it charge and was powering off the Dot so I moved the Dot to the bluetooth connection on my entertainment system and got the new Echo for the living room. This little speaker sounds really good and looks so much better than previous generations. When we got our first Echo it was more of a novelty for playing music but has become much more.

I had two Echo speakers, one the original and one the newer generation, and I have several Echo Dots so I am already a fan. However, I could not resist the new red one for my kitchen and actually traded in an older Dot to justify the acquisition! It's wonderful in my kitchen and I use sit all the time, for listening to AudioBooks, for streaming music, and for general inquiries-great for kitchen math quick answers to divide recipes! And it is so pretty. Love it.

I am in love with this generation of Echo! I read several of the reviews before purchasing, and previously have only owned the Echo Dot. Wow. What a major sound quality difference! This has become my go-to for music when I'm cooking, cleaning and in general doing anything that needs some motivation around the house. The bass is impressive for such a small thing - nice deep, non-fuzzing lows with some serious thump I actually felt on the floor. (The Echo is placed on my kitchen table) I ran through quite a gamut of music from Home Free, Post Malone, Star Wars instrumental, a little In This Moment and I was pleased with the quality of them all. If you see this lil puppy on sale - snap it right up! I can't wait to host a party and get this Echo bumpin'!

Don't be fooled by Bose and those expensive speakers this is every bit as good at a fraction of the cost.  Even one speaker provides enough oomph to make internet radio pop.  I bought because I wanted the personal assistant (which by the way is more intelligent that Siri) but was blown away by the sound quality.  Voice recognition was flawless.  Apple which normally makes set up of hardware and software a great experience should take notice.

Until I purchased my third generation Echo earlier this month, I had no idea what I was missing from my Amazon Prime account. I found Amazon Music to be much more to my liking than Prime Video, which my wife and I have enjoyed for several years. The sound quality of the third generation full height Echo is well worth the approximately $60 I paid against my Amazon account. Well done, Amazon. You have enriched my life with Amazon Prime Music.

I bought one of the original Echos mostly for fun.  It has been a great product, but The sound for music was no better than OK. This new version is a huge improvement in terms of sound.  True audiophiles need to look elsewhere.  However, the average listener will find the sound highly rewarding especially when this Echo is available on sale.  At $60, I highly recommend it.  At $100, you might want to save up for the Echo Studio costing $200.

Great device!  Extremely clear, clean sound.  It has a good look, very stream lined.  I have the sandstone color.  Made my first phone call very clear, quick and easy.  Love my new alexa echo.  Really hooked on it.  She gives my daily news update, puts me to sleep with tranquil music, and wakes me up when I ask to set alarm.  My A-I is the BOMB!!  I JUST WISH SHE COULD MAKE ME DINNER, AND CLEAN MY HOUSE!  SOMEDAY THESE ROBOTS WILL BE DOING THAT!!!!!!

I have the original Echo I purchased years ago and it's just as goos as this brand new one, NO BETTER. I bought its because the original one wouldn't speak Spanish.  my wife speaks Spanish I I wanted to be able to talk to Echo with both English and Spanish simotanously, as advertised.  I changed the setup under the settings to do so but it only recognizes Englis,  So all I really haver is two Echos that do the exact same thing.  Bad buy.

The sound quality is good, I'm considering adding the Echo subwoofer. I wish Alexa was more intelligent and would process quicker but I guess that will come in time, and with more money. I kind of hoped the sound quality would've been better since previously I was just listening to music on my phone this one isn't a huge improvement over that. I feel it would be more worth $50 than $80 but its ok. I definitely do appreciate voice commands.

We are enjoying our Echo. We use it to play music,  as a timer during cooking, play quizzes on it and when we leave our home we say "Alexa we are leaving and it responds with I'll start guarding your home" . It will respond to any breaking glass etc. I think we will enjoy having it. The only negative that I have found is that you need to very precise in your questions. I asked our far the state capital was from my home and it heard the Missouri state capital and gave me a distance of several thousand miles.
Love this speaker have cameras and ring doorbell and everything connected. I’ve switched from google home to Alexa

Love this generation Echo. I imagined I would want to add the subwoofer, but simply putting it closer to the corner yields plenty of bass - though the bass is not nearly tight enough but the 3 band equalizer in the app helps tune it a bit. Instead of a sub, I am strongly considering a 2and unit to have true stereo. For a kitchen music device this thing kicks butt, in a melodic and harmonious way, of course!  Get it. You wont regret it.

I own both the 2nd and 3rd generation echos. The sound of the 3rd generation is significantly better. However, I prefer the sharper line of the 2nd over the rounded edges on the 3rd. But, if you are trying to decide which echo to get, this is the one. It worth it for the sound alone.

The Echo was to be an upgrade to the DOT which works great but lacked good audio quality due to its small size. The Echo is ok, better sound, but not great sound as I was expecting. It seems to lack good mid-range, and an artificial base sound. Even with the simple three band equalizer as a feature of the app, it is not quite balanced. It’s like a poorly engineered Bose sound. Considering that Bose is a pretty good standard for small boxes. The other issue is it needs rebooting once a week as it seems to get bound up on itself and freezes. I can only speak for this one, as mine may have issues of its own, while Echo for others may perform better.
This Alexa 3rd Generation sounds good has a deeper bass,I also have 1 2nd Generation a big difference in the sound quality

Got this on Black Friday, the sound is unbelievable for such a small device. It really does have pretty good base (compared to the dot). I use it in my kitchen along with a dot in the dining room and another dot in the living room. I live in a historic house that is on an occasional home tour and use it as a part of a whole house sound system for back ground music. Easy to hookup and to program and the prices were so much cheaper than anything else comparable.

2 stars for ease of setup, turning on, getting my network and for sound playing and hearing me. 3rd star for its color, light blue. 4th star is just being nice and having more bass then gen 1 and for being smaller. Voice recognition doesn't work well, just like the gen 1 2 people in the house and we both see the problem. No matter of placement. I had to upgrade because of price and generation.

I LOVE my echo! Bass is loud, and overall sounds GREAT. HOWEVER, the woman in tech support was really nasty with me. She was testing me as if I'm some dumb customer who should know how to set up the WiFi properly, when I told her it just kept exiting the set up mode on its own. She was pretty impatient with me when she told me how to reboot the device. I said to her to just forget it, and I found a YouTube video how to fix the issue property.

Great deal paired with the smart plug! The Echo set up quickly with Alexa...enhanced the sound when set up multi room with my Echo Dots. Provides deeper and richer sound than the Dots alone. The Amazon smart plug also set up quickly with Alexa, and it operates well with voice commands or remotely through the Alexa app. My thinking was to add the more affordable Echo before considering purchasing the sub-woofer. So far, it was a wise purchase!

I have had nothing but issues with this echo. I had an echo dot before this and other than it having a few sound issues when turned up to high it worked well. The echo constantly has problems playing my Audible books, saying she's having trouble playing the book. Also 3 times now I've had to unplug and plug it back in because it just randomly stopped working. When it does work, the sound is nice, for both audiobooks and music.

I bought this as a gift for my mom who is NOT tech savvy at all. The setup was easy and she hit it off with Alexa! This has helped her become more aware of the way technology works and she can ask Alexa before calling to ask me while I am at work. 😬 the only minor thing is she would like it to be a little louder when she listens to music. I am planning on getting her some dots to place in other rooms. But overall this item was a great gift for anyone cuz now my 7 year old wants one too!

I bought three  of them and I loved them for a month.  I ahd two and subwoofer as a speaker set .  Now they wont't stero pair and I can't paly my Amazon.  I spent 90 minutes with Amazon yesterday and I that was a waste of time setting and resetting. Then i tried to pair them again and nothing. I told Amazon the issue and hoped they would fix it but this morning nothing was fixed.  Finally took another hour to fix it and now it's wonderful again

3rd generation Echo is a good product.  Set up is very easy compared to my 1st gen Echo.  I do prefer the 1st gen Echo though.  I feel the 1st gen Echo's sound is much better, and I love the changing the volume by spinning the top edge of the 1st gen Echo.  It is much better way to change the volume then asking Alexa to do it or by pressing the 3rd gen Echo's +/- buttons.  But overall I am satisfied with the 3rd gen Echo.

The speaker works well. What was not clear to me (could very well be my fault!) is that it doesn't work with the subwoofer (echo) that I bought and you can only pair 2. I thought I could have several and music through out my house but that isn't the case. I have 2 of the echo 3rd gens in Master bedroom and then 2 dots working with sub woofer. They all work well but this was a draw back that I feel Amazon does not go out of it's way to make clear.

We were given an Alexa with a subsidiary Echo Dot for Christmas,  which we placed in the living room and kitchen. We like it so much that we purchased an additonal Echo Dot for the library upstairs. We haven't explored all the functions, but so far we've found it very helpful for music in different locations, as well as being able to add to the shopping list whenever an item occurs, rather than wait til we are able to write it down on a shopping list. An additional feature is that when someone is out grocery shopping, and the one at home suddenly remembers something which they'd forgotten was needed, they can add it to the list, and it appears on the shopper's phone. Very helpful!

My daughter & I both have tried to exchange this product. I’ve had trouble with it responding to request to turn music on or off. The customer service agent I talked to offered to refund the money. She bought it on sale & neither of us want to reorder & pay the regular price. It works most of the time but the times it has not responded leads me to believe there is a defect. My daughter & I both have gotten the runaround from Customer Service.

I also have a Google Home in the house, so, the smack down has begun.  There has been more than several questions that Alexa could not give answers to but GH gave thorough answers.  I have found that Alexa has an incredible sound system, even at 5% it seems it is blasting away. And the headphone jack is fantastic, in a home of multiple people in the house listening to stuff on their devices.  I don’t always work in bright lights. I don’t like the fact that you have to have a light on and wear glasses to see the buttons.  The Alexa has a yellow, ring light the keeps coming on periodically, which gives the impression that I am being listened to, kind of creepy.  When I ask Alexa about I don’t get an answer. Generally, I am very pleased with the administrative aspect of Alexa.  It has done a nice job of syncing calendars, reminders, etc. as well as giving me a sense that more than one device can be used for Alexa, i.e. television. I would like to have had to capability to reach over and select volume, or even turn it off with my touch, but the voice turn off suffices.

We got better service from our earlier generation. model. Maybe the problem is that there are, Multiple Generations in the house. She doesn't listen well, Sometimes she doesn't respond at all. She does not play music periodically. And then when she does she doesn't play it on the everywhere group like I asked. The list goes on. I'm just frustrated at this point. Considering returning it to get my money back. Love the color though...

I bought it during black Friday for 59.99 what a bargain. I love everything about it. I've been using my gf Echo 1st gen but I wanted something for myself and I'm glad I bought this. The sound quality is amazing and Alexa is way better than Siri.

I think Alexa is creepy at times. She started talking and I couldn't get her to stop! People told me the TV set her off, so I moved her. She still doesn't tell me things I really want an answer to. Any suggestions? I got her as a gift and I can't say it's anything I really was interested in.

Got this as a gift so I don’t know how much of a value it is but I like it a lot. Easy to use and so convenient. Just tell Alexa what you want. I had it on shelf with loud deep base music and it fell off. Worked fine after that accident. Lots of music  but you may want to buy Amazon Music Unlimited if you want some music such as Led Zeppelin which is not included in Prime. They do offer a free 30 day trial.

I wanted to hook it up with my original Alexa but it’s not compatible.  I tried on the app and moving it a few rooms away but it still can’t connect. Also I can only play 1 at a time . I don’t know if I’m doing something wrong or not but if I play the one upstairs the old one downstairs don’t play online music.  I upgraded my amazon music account to 7.99 a month but still can’t figure it out .  My internet is great also .

It has been a great addition. Our kids love to have their own dance party it whatever room they’re in. We got several of them for around the house and they’re a breeze to sync together or play individually...just form a group in your Alexa app. These go on sale all of the time so just wait for them to go on sale and scoop up a few. Added plus...there’s a ton of smart plugs out there and it’s made life a lot easier.

Bought to replace 2nd Gen DOT that was temperamental (small disc-type). This one listens better,  sounds better,  and doesn't delay when connected to the Bose speaker like the old one.  Always sounded like an outdoor concert (echo) when moving from one room to another. This is not the smart hub... so make sure you're getting the right unit for your needs as they look alike. You won't be disappointed.

I have 2nd Gen and I loved them I have to as a matter of fact. When I saw 3rd Gen come out I was too happy. Saw them come on sale for black Friday and had to get 2. I gave the 2nd gen to my mother I put the 3rd gen in my bed room and the sound beautiful fills the room with sound. Worth the price I am a fan of Echo. I also have 3 Echo shows as well. Just to show I'm not just talking. Waiting for the Sub woofer.

I bought this on black Friday due to my Echo V. 1 broke . I do not recall seeing the stats on v.3 but what a surprise when I plugged it in. In addition to working flawlessly, the music quality is much better, especially with my Amazons UHD music subscription. Nice bass for such a small attractive Echo. I'm a lifelong audiophile and can now use my Echo 3 to play music for something other than background noise.

This is my first Echo, before this, I only had Echo dot. The biggest difference is the ability to crank up the volume. The sound quality is great, and LOUD. It's shockingly loud for the small size! There is no downside at all, if you want an Echo for music, this is a GREAT buy in every way! I got it in red, and had to wait a few weeks for it, but I'm glad I did, and would absolutely buy it again.

I bought three of these this Christmas... One for a granddaughter ten .. two for my twin daughters ... they are all having a ball asking this ALEXA all kinds of things.... It's a learning experience... I did mess up and put that one for g daughter app on my phone which when she took it home it didn't recognize her home... hopefully that will be resolved.... Amazon support gave me answers  immediately about that question... great gifts this year...

Music sounds really good and Alexa's voice is loud and clear.  I only wish I had bought one of these sooner.  Am having so much fun with it.  The light blue speaker looks very nice sitting in the living room.  Shipping was fast and no damage.

I like the product. It is very helpful for things like checking the weather forecast, tracking amazon packages, playing music, etc. There are a few downsides, however. Every once in a while it mistakes a random phrase for the activation word and turns on. Usually it turns off soon after, but it has sometimes mistaken what I was saying to someone else as a question for it and begins to rattle off an answer. Then there are times where I ask it a question and it turns on but doesn’t answer. The blue light ring just stays on. When this happens, I always need to unplug the echo and plug it back in to solve the issue. A bit tedious as it happens about once a week. I’d say that this is a good product overall, but I don’t like how the issues seem to be popping up more often. The two problems I mentioned are the only ones I’ve noticed so far, but they are fairly big ones to me.

Aside from all the things the Echo is able to do, we purchased this device for my daughter who is a high school dance major. She has to practice her choreography a lot and is constantly having to stop and go over to her phone to replay or rewind her music. Being able to speak to Alexa and have her pause or rewind a song however many seconds needed has been really helpful to my daughter. It allows her to focus more on her dance without losing momentum or focus. The sound quality is excellent. We have enjoyed using the Echo, as well, for all the other added conveniences a smart device brings to the home and I can see us purchasing a few more in the future.

I love my Alexa! It's not perfect by any means. The sync system is off no matter how many times I mess with it. For example, Alexa can turn on the TV no problem. However, it won't actually control the television (like changing channels or turning the TV back off). At the same time, it's AWESOME for listening to music. The sound is incredible! The music selection is vast, too. So, I give it a solid four.

Alexa Echo lives up to they hype. Alexa is more intuitive and easier to use than "Hey Google" on our phone. We especially like being able to "drop in" on the kids when they are home alone and they let their phones die. The sound quality is very good. The Echo connects with our Spotify account but is sometimes difficult getting it to play from a saved playlist; it will play individual songs just fine. The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is that we just really don't use it that much. After the first couple weeks of "new toy" time we just don't see a need for it that much. Still a very cool product.

This is honestly a 2 star experience for me until I there is an option in the app to delay the internal speaker audio. IMPORTANT: All models of amazon echos do not currently have any way to delay the aux output and each model has a different fixed latency at the aux out. If you are looking to use the Echo to drive a bigger system for multi room, you must buy the same Echo model and you must use the aux output at each endpoint. If you use aux at one endpoint and internal speaker at another there will be a perceivable delay between the two devices. There should be a way to manually delay the device with the internal speaker to align to the latent audio of the device with aux out, but there isn’t. I work as an engineer at a networked audio company and we do this all the time - it is professional industry standard. It is possible and it would make this product incredible.

Aun Alexa esta muy elemental en Informacion, le pides música por ejemplo y te envía a que compres app de Musica, la opción libre  por ejemplo de Marc Anthony solo te pone 1 y las demás ni son del mismo genero y nada que  ver con el artista. Por otro lado es simpática, cada vez que le dices Buenos Dias pues te da informacion, canta muy bien y los chicos se divierten en casa y aprenden algunas cosas. Esta en Español es una nueva mejor opción para muchos.

I am a first time Echo owner. It's been nice. It is a great speaker. It also has answers to random questions we have. The kids like asking Alexa for jokes, play games , etc. I like to use it to set timers, and listen to music. I'm sure there are a lot of other features that I don't know about yet. The only bad thing is that when my kindle is in the same room, it hears my voice better when I say "Alexa" and tries to respond. Over all, I'm glad I got it.

Alexa follows basic commands.....I have an issue with the device turning itself off and the only way I've found to fix it is to unplug it and the plug it back in. It does this at least once a day. I've called customer service which recommended plugging the device into it's own dedicated socket.....I had it plugged in on a surge protector bar. I haven't had any problems with it since then.....but that was just last night, so we'll see. I guess no technology is perfect. Whoops!....my music just stopped and the device is again not responding......not good.

The new Echo seems to do everything as well as my Gen 1 unit, but the new speakers provide deeper bass. The one difference I didn’t see as an improvement was that changing the volume manually on the new unit is done by pressing a + or - button instead of turning the rotating ring used on the Gen 1. Using these buttons, especially in the dark, is a hit or miss proposition, especially since there are 4 of them, all the same size, so no way to distinguish by feel. The ring was not only more intuitive, but I always got the desired result. I know that volume can be adjusted by voice, but then you can’t hear the program material as Alexa changes the volume. This is a minor complaint, more of an observation. One thing I really like is being able to synchronize playback on both units. I will probably add a third unit to get music (or whatever) playing throughout the house.

I have to admit I resisted buying one since I wanted to make sure all the bugs were out before I took the plunge. It works fantastic. Truly. I haven't really taken it out for a real "test ride" as of yet. But I will very soon. Right now it's in our bathroom so we have music to listen to when we're in there. The only thing that would make this even better would to have it rechargable since the cord is unsightly.

I really love my echo I wish it was compatible with Apple Music.  I was thrilled to know I could make it portable with the portable battery base..yea, now I’m really in love with my echo. I think in the description you should advertise that you can go portable with a a separate purchase of the battery base.  I think that would Encourage more people to purchase the echo making a portable is so convenient.

It’s so nice to walk into my house and with a few words I can turn on my lights, disarm my alarm and play music.  I sleep to thunderstorm sounds, my daughter plays twister w her friends and Alexa”spinning.”  I bought two echo plus and two echo dots... music plays throughout the house.  Only negative is music quality is noticeably less than my Bose but... the convenience of voice control is worth it.

It is super cool that you can speak both English and Spanish at the same time to Alexa. I honestly thought that was not possible. This is the feature that I appreciate the most, since it is very useful to me when I am asking Alexa to play Cumbias in Spotify. The sound quality is superb, I have linked my echo to My fire TV stick and now when I I'm watching a movie the sound quality improved tremendously, it did the job as a soundbar. So I could say that you can probably call it a "smart soundbar". When I got this gift it included a Smart switch from Kasa and it makes it very easy to turn on and off my room lamp through echo. Overall I can say that I am pretty satisfied with the quality of the sound and the easiness of which Alexa understands both languages.

My new Echo has TERRIBLE voice recognition I can be standing in the same room close to her and she NOT hear me but my dot in our office and in our bedroom will hear me its very frustrating.  I have a Generation 1 Echo and her voice recognition is MUCH better.  Please if there is a setting I'm  missing to help with her voice recognition please leave me a comment.  Also, I feel my generation 1 had much better integration capabilities.

i owned echo 1st, 2nd and 3rd generation and i can notice an improvement on the sound quality on this one, there is more bass and the sound is more clear, the voice recognition improved in terms of distance compared with the other versions, the functionality with the skills and other stuff there is no difference from what i can see, this one can speak spanish. the only thing i really miss is the volume control of the the 1st version.

I received my Echo smart-speaker for Christmas, and I was very excited although a little unsure since I am not the most tech-savvy. However, it was super simple to set up and navigate, and Alexa helps by offering suggestions of what you can do or say. I ordered an Alexa compatible smart plug about a month later (which was also super simple and easy to set up), and I absolutely love the fact that I can ask Alexa to turn on or off my living room light, including all the other functions that she does. I sometimes feel lazy now that I have her to do so many things (such as setting a timer or alarm, updating me on the current weather, playing my music, turning up or down the volume, answering my questions, etc) but I've definitely gotten used to my Echo and appreciate how much it's able to do!

It depend what you want to use it for >one of my need is  to turn the light on and off and it will be useful for my 90th years old mam  , I discover that I have to buy certain light compatible with the devise  which is expensive  about $35 for each light . I want to use it as security system for my home  ,now I have to change my old security system to other kind which is compatible with the device , that will cost me  $150 .It did not meet my need . wasting of money . If you want it to listen to music ,news jocks ideas it is very good .even alarm

I had a little confusion on my part when installing,.  I had purchased an Echo Dot, believing this was what I needed. Found out I needed the 2 items in order to incorporate the Dot. I guess I need a long cord to connect the two units. Overall, a friendly, helpful, convenient and fun device when I need a quick answer, or an urge to play some music I don't hear anymore on today's radio or TV.

We use it primarily for controlling lighting, grocery lists, egg timer/alarm, and reminders and works well for those tasks. It typically has trouble understanding what we want if we ask for something else. Music, in particular, is difficult to play. We should be able to play music from our smartphones or from prime music but it doesn't usually work. When we ask for weather, it mentions a neighboring local city, not the name of our suburb, even though it has our address/location with zip code.  I suppose it's a learning process to get it connected with devices and get it to understand us. Sometimes it makes suggestions, like ask "this" but when we do, it responds that it doesn't understand what we want. Frustrating.

We like this new version of the Echo. Our #1 Echo got knocked over by the cats a few too many times (and the final time by me) and eventually stopped working. I ordered this one—and changed the place we keep it, so hopefully it will not get knocked over by the cats or by me again. Setup was very quick and easy. It works like the other Echos. We like the sound of it, so we’re happy with that.

wasted a lot of money buying 2 echos and a subwoofer that don't play on music unlimited plan unless you pay for the multiple device plan even though your only listening to one song in one place . i think it would be nice if amazon told you that before you bought it. i make a lot of purchases from them every year and am a prime member as well i might start to look elsewhere for my shopping needs. very disappointed would really think twice about wasting your money on this set. would not recommend. amazon support was no help either.

Just love my Amazon Alexa. I really love the feature on being able to request and hear songs I love. Also like that I can send my wife a message from my Smart phone to our Alexa. The sound of the music is just like having a big stereo system. So very handy to as Alexa for the weather in Bisbee, or in another country. Alexa can be a lot of company if someone is alone, and wants to hear the news or something. I can also have Alexa  call my cell phone for my wife. My wife had a stroke and bought this item to give her some company and help. I am a very happy customer on my buy.

Nice little sound system as oppose to using the large home stereo, easy to set up via smart phone. For its size it produces full sound quite well, a little bass heavy and could use a little more top end,  but all in all I'm quite happy with the Echo device. Apparently it does quite a bit, however I bought it for music play back while I read and works excellent for all intended purposes.

I got this mainly to listen to music, especially Christmas music.  I have enjoyed having it so much.  I listen to music all the time and have made specific playlists.  I've asked Alexa questions and have a good time listening to the answers she comes up with.  I like it so much that I bought a second one for the master bedroom.  I love the Twilight Blue color I bought for the bedroom.

It's my first smart speaker and I like it so far. I'm positive that it can do much more than I'm currently asking of it. At minimum, I wanted a clock radio, but this gives me so much more. Since I got it on sale, it wasn't too much more expensive than a clock radio and the sound quality and its capabilities far exceed what a clock radio can offer.  It took a little effort to set it up, but everything works great now.

I recently purchased an Echo Dot for my son and was pleased with the sound for such a small device. I then decided to by this full sized Echo for my wife. The sound is very good. The bass is surprisingly good and the mids and highs are excellent. I can't imagine getting better sound for the money ($59.99 on sale). The voice recognition works well in English. I haven't tried it in Spanish yet.

After having been introduced to the Echo Dot, I thought I would go for its larger brother, the Echo, for its better sound.  Using a Gift Card, I purchased it from Target about two weeks ago.  I learned, however, I needed to install a special Amazon app on my cell phone to initiate and complete the process.  The installation was fairly straight-forward. Soon afterward, our son give us a smart plug to turn on/off the living room light.  How handy!  I am sure the other possibilities are virtually endless. Glad to be brought into the 21st century with these smart devices!  Recommended.

In general they are great, my refurbished first gen served us without issue for years and has been passed on to family. This new one doesn't listen, fails to execute/acknowledge commands and randomly crackles like it has bad wiring. Currently awaiting customer service to rectify with more than poorly written responses telling me of tech support and that the item is out of stock for replacement (spoiler alert, it is not out of stock)

I am almost totally satisfied with this device. I use it daily and frequently to help me get through the day. I have recently had to put my wife in a memory care facility, because she has dementia. I had hoped she could use the device, but it’s too complicated for her in her condition. She has no short-term memory at this time, and still can’t remember how to operate the device. Also, the change in volume level as music is played, frustrates her. At one moment it is too soft, at the next it is too loud. Too bad it doesn’t have AVC, Automatic volume control such as we have on radios.

Me gustó puedo mover todos los dispositivos , cualquier pregunta se puede jugar muchas cosas más,  y no me gusto que no escucha bien con el volumen alto , no es recargable  en caso  de se valla usa sólo con Bluetooth.

I love this,  but it has a flaw... it recognizes kids voices.  This means I've heard baby shark more often than anyone should have to endure.  The sound quality is great.  Baby shark can be turned up and heard throughout the house. It does seem to have a glitch.  I need to unplug it and reset it about once a week.  I keep hoping it will stop doing that but it hasn't after a few weeks of ownership.  I would have said it was more stars if it wasn't for that.

What I dislike like and maybe someone can answer this - I can call out on Alexa to my contacts and talk to them however, I can not answer in coming calls from my contacts on Alexa.  She states "no incoming call" even though my phone is ringing.  I do like having the ability to listen to music, weather etc. without pulling out my phone or having the TV on.  I would recommend this product highly.

It's clear that the product has evolved since the original echo I purchased way way way way back when. However I I do feel like the speakers are not quite the same quality individually that they used to be. I have seen stereo pairs with the subwoofers sound amazing at what really is a good price for a 2.1 home audio system but I had higher expectations of the individual unit.

My Echo dot units seem to do a better job of understanding what I'm saying. For some reason the Echo gets confused. I've tried moving it's location and to speak more clearly, she just has issues...not sure why :(

Love the spontaneous ability to call up music on a whim. I’m not extremely tech savvy so I did have to call in and have help setting it up. That was easy and Amazon gets a 6 star for their help. The unit seems to get lost and forgets what is supposed to be doing. Things like playing more than one song by the artist. We mainly purchased this to play music throughout our home and was unaware there was a limit to “how many” echos connected together. As we purchased a package of 3 echos and a sub. The limit is said to be three, leaving us with a “rouge” echo. Still nice and for the money the sound is great for us. All in all it’s a good product we may just need to know better.

This is my second Alexa. My first was a refurbished older one to see if it was really all that. Just like my many Kindle’s and Fire’s, I don’t know how I ever got along without them. Alexa does everything. She finds the best NPR stations for me not to mention playing my favorite music and reminding me of appointments and so many other things I have yet to learn.

I didn't expect this kind of sound coming out of an echo device! I'm seriously impressed!  The sound is crisp and rich and even has some decent bass with out a subwoofer!  And since I bought it on Black Friday, it was delivered to my door at a fabulous price! It basically set itself up so quickly I was almost disappointed that I didn't have to do more!  I highly recommend this product!

We are really enjoying our Alexa.  Mostly we use it to listen to Amazon Unlimited Music, but it is so convenient to get information quickly, such as what time does the Super Bowl start, what is the weather forecast for the day, who won the Heisman  Trophy this year, etc.  My hubby really didn't want to purchase an Echo originally, but he enjoys it now more than ever.

Alexa turns her self on without me talking to her. Several times I have come into the house to find Alexa on with some radio station. I often leave the radio on as I am in & out so assumed she heard something on the radio, not my voice. About 4AM this morning I woke up & Alexa was talking away! There was no radio or TV on & I sleep in another room with the door closed. I asked Alexa who turned her on, she said she could not answer that question. It is kind of a fun toy, not sure she is worth the money.

When it works the sound is great. However, it doesn’t work very often. Sometimes it’ll play when I want to play and then it’ll just stop. Or sometimes the subwoofer will play but then the echo won’t. We have no clue why it does this because customer support won’t call us back. Even though they said they would. So, we are going to return it because this sucks.

Hands down voice recognition on the Echo 3rd Gen is way better than Bose 500. I purchased a Bose 500 with Alexa because that wife wanted better audio than the Echo Dot...so I went all in and well we were very disappointed in the Bose voice recognition. But this Echo is spot on and yes the sound quality isn't studio quality but it satisfies the wife.

What a change from my Echo (1st Gen). The sound is amazing out of this small form factor device. I actually enjoy listening to music on it. I especially love that you can change the 3.5mm jack to either Input or Output. That is a very useful feature. I connected an old streaming device to the new echo and I can listen to my music library through the new Echo speaker. This is a definite upgrade from my original 1st Gen echo.I may start upgrading all my original Echos.

DON'T BUY THESE FOR ANYTHING OTHER THAN SINGLE ECHO Super disappointed in these. Not only is Alexa nowhere close to being AI as she cant do nearly any simple thing you ask her. NOTE: When these are paired into a Stereo Configuration (as they advertise you can do) you lose the two of the main features of these devices; 1. If paired  into Stereo you can not stream to it via your mobile phone bluetooth 2. If Paired and using the One In you can only play one the device you are physically plugged into, again losing Stereo Pairing and losing your Echo Sub if you have one, which we do. Super bummed because the return window has closed so I'm stuck with these rather dumb devices.

I got this as a Christmas gift for my son-in-law. He is extremely happy with it and uses it mostly to listen to music and to control his smart appliances.  The sound quality of this echo is incredible and is able to be turned very loud but without any distortion. He has had no trouble having it recognize his voice, not so easy for me with a Scottish accent!

El sonido de este parlante es realmente sorprendente. Lo compré en un Best Buy en Orlando Florida y tuve la oportunidad de comparar su sonido con un Bose Soundlink Revolve y el Echo lo deja por el piso. Este Echo tiene un sonido realmente bueno. Una de sus características es que tiene un procesador y bocinas premium con tecnología Dolby que reproducen sonido de 360° impecable. En definitiva, este es parlante que estaba buscando y lo recomiendo muchísimo. Ojalá algún día salga un Echo con batería para llevarlo sin cables a cualquier parte.... es lo único que le falta para ser perfecto

Somewhat disappointed.  The voice recognition isn’t as good as my original Echo.  I know, I know:  lots of people said that in the reviews, but...sigh.  Consequently, I kept my original Echo, along with this one. Update: the thing is a complete pain!  Not only is the microphone awful, it has now stopped responding when I attempt to use the volume buttons.  What the hell, Amazon?!  Not sure if I can still return both this and the battery I purchased, but I’m going to look into it.

We've been blown away at how Fabulous the sound is. Bose can't be better or much better! We've been asking for songs we want to hear and then along those lines, Alexa's additional suggestions are great! And yeah, setting up our song playlists; as well as our shopping lists is really nice.  And shut the Front door.... us older folks only had to plug it in and set up was almost instant!!!

I received Alexa as a Christmas gift from my children. I like the idea that I can ask Alexa to play a song that I like without having to use a radio and listen to ads and all kinds of interruptions. This is a wonderful gift that I really love. There are so many things I can ask Alexa, i.e., what is the weather, what time is it, etc. It was easy to set up.

Don't wish to review, I did the trade in for my echo and it was in perfect condition at time of return however once Amazon received it it was rated non-working and in poor cosmedic condition. This negated the 30$ turn in valuse which subsequently overdrew my account. I called and after a bit they refunded my 30$ but did not and would not cover the overdrawn fee of 25$ the support person said she escalated my issue up a level and I have yet to hear back. Now this 25$ overdraft fee has grown to 50$ very unhappy to say the lease

I knew the capabilities of this device before I bought it and of course, that’s why I wanted it. However, I didn’t realize just how much I’d love it! I’m a stay at home mom, so I spend most of my time going from room to room cleaning, folding laundry, etc. I got 2 devices. An Echo for the bedroom, and a Show for the dining room. I like to play music on them. It’s like having in-home surround sound but without the expensive installation! I’ll definitely be getting more echoes to place around my home to amplify the experience.

Have had this for about a month and was able to connect it to my Alexa easily and it worked fine for a while, but recently it’s been having some trouble knowing when to sync with Alexa (for music) and when not to. A lot of static and cutting off happening. Planning on giving it a little more time before I contact Amazon for a replacement. Never had any issues with my Alexa, so disappointed.

I got this to play music while doing household work and cooking.  I love the timer and I love most of the little weather things I get.  I do not have a smart house so it is limited use.  But I do love the sound quality.  I also enjoy that if I do not want anything to be heard I can hit a mute button (not that I have anything to hide).  But love the option.

Generally, for relatively minor functional (feature) changes I don't usually move to upgrade. After all, the 2nd Edition was great! However, if you use your Echo a lot and look for the sound to be consistent across the frequency spectrum and at all volume levels (for its class, of course), then you will find this update worth the move. The high-ends are not tinny, and the bass is sufficiently booming without over blowing the mid range. And it is a little more responsive to voice command - but not so much as to be obvious to casual users. Nice update for the sound quality. (However, when there is a 4th Edition I'll be expecting major feature changes... just saying :-) )

My daughter bought this for me for Christmas and I was unsure if I wanted it.  The Echo has been so much fun!  I enjoy asking for my favorite music to be played, adding items to grocery list- which is hooked up to my iPhone to use at grocery store.  It also can tell me the temperature or weather, tell a joke, or play a game.  How did I live without it?

This is the future? Then I want NONE OF IT. I am a self proclaimed computer/gadget nerd and was waiting for the 3rd generation.  Call this one the POS Generation. This unit continues to ignore my commands. It hears me, blue, yellow then dark. If I wanted to be ignored, I would have stayed married. I have reset reset reset, deleted app, downloaded app, reset reset reset. This thing is about as stupid as my ex. Nice job Amazon. You make me want to go back to Apple which I swore I never would.

Uuufff hey do not hesitate to buy the alexa the best of the best sound quality is the same as the JBL and of the most expensive I already have the 2nd generation and this the 3rd speaks for itself only alexa the best. or and I have in my room the best sound in volvente also very easy to connect just follow the application of alexa and already super easy connection.

I just completed setup of 3rd generation paired speakers.  I also purchased adjustable speaker stands to have them at ear level (while sitting down).  For the price of these speakers, can't beat it.  Loving the stereo sound after having a single echo plus in the den.  Your going to spend a lot more to get better sound.  Good deal... happy customer!

Most everything is good, easy to use and doesn’t take up much space.  Set up was also easy.  The problem I have been having is a couple of times so far there is static in the speaker and it pops and goes out.  I couldn’t get it to turn off after multiple requests........and then it finally turned off.  The other one I have in the basement has had no problems.

Work my lights, handles my internet queries, helps organize our lives with timers, calling features and drop ins. I almost forgot the music! Deep bass crisp highs. Sterio pair two of these for a full and excellent sound. Listen with pandora and amazon music as well as others. Get your news and stay private as you please. ECHO. Get 4. You’re welcome.

I love the sound on the newer echo, vs the original one.  I've moved the older one into another room and the sound on that beats the sound on the echo dot, so it's a win.  The only problem I've had with it is that it doesn't respond as quickly as my other echo devices.  Sometimes, I have to say the "wake" name a couple of times before it wakes up.

Love the improvements made on the GEN 3s sound quality, makes our gen 2s sound lacking. Went with the Blue color and very happy. Using 6 echos and 4 dots to provide full house coverage, and they work very well together. The app can glitch a little with the various listening groups, but with a little patience everything is starting to work exactly as it should.

I mostly use this product for listening to music. It's worked for me thus far and adding songs to my playlist is convenient. I'm just a little concerned about the "always on" microphone. Seems like it could easily be used as a wiretap, and judging from some articles, that is a major concern for this product. I'm definitely uneasy about it keeping a record of anything I say, and while the policy claims it's not spying on customers, it's difficult to know if that's legitimately true or just a claim to avoid potential lawsuits.

I loved the first one so much I bought another for my bedroom. I had an Echo dot, but the sound quality isn’t great for playing music. This sound quality rivals my Bose Bluetooth speaker, and turns on easily at my command. I am playing music so much more than I ever did because it’s so easy. Love it.

I thought being pre-digital that I would not like this type of device. I wanted to see what all the fuss was about so ordered one. Completely blew my mind with the sound quality. And Alexa knows everything. I asked her the address of my elementry school (thatis no longer), and darn if she didn't give me the address when the schoo closed and what is there now. Wish Alexa I could have taken Alexa to school!

the quality of this product is very durable. i love the sound quality, and the voice recognition is out of this world! i could be 10 feet away from it and it would probably still pick up my voice. i didn’t like how whenever i asked to play a song it would shuffle play the radio (of that specific song) but that was solved by a connection to spotify (although when i ask to play a playlist, it plays a different playlist made by spotify, for example, even if i said the name exactly). anyways, overall, this is an amazing product! i love how theres games, weather, and even sleep sounds built in to the echo. the only setback is that this needs to be plugged in (if you unplug it, it’ll automatically turn off :c) in order for it to work. i’m extremely satisfied with this version of the amazon echo :))

Since I had an Echo in the Family Room, I decided to buy 2 Echo Dots for the Master Bedroom and the Computer Room to act as intercoms.  I keep the sound at a reasonably level for music, questions, and timers/reminders/alarms, but it is too hard to hear the other room when I DROP IN.  There needs to be a skill that can do multiple steps so I can increase the sound at each end, listen/talk, then set the sound back to the original level when I'm done using  as an intercom.

I just upgraded from an Echo Dot to the latest Echo device, and overall I am quite pleased.  The sound quality is amazingly better for playing music from multiple sources, and interaction with Alexa is also very good.  The only quibble I have is that the new Echo does not seem to recognize my voice commands as easily as the Echo Dot when I am farther away from it; and there are a few commands that, somehow, the Echo does not understand (although the Echo Dot certainly did, and does).  Nonetheless, I am still very pleased I made the upgrade.

I got Alexa for radio, pod casts, and the occasional song. Audio is clear and loud with a smaller foot print than the radio/computer. Simply tell Alexa the station ID, and it will change stations.   Before I bought this device, I verified it would work with Windows 7, since it must be connected to a wireless modem using your home computer. (I do not have an i-phone.) When I tried to download the Alexa application software, the download would not finish due to my inadequate web security software. I had to purchase web security software and the help desk cleaned my disk of files I didn't even know I had. My machine runs much faster and Alexa works great. The help desk was very helpful and answered any question/concern I had.   Maybe if I had Apple based computer at home or an i-phone this wouldn't have been a problem??

We upgraded are original echo with this after reading about the upgraded sound. The sound is amazing with full bass and mids. Many small speakers fall flat when in these two areas. Besides the sound, the small shape and color options are added bonuses. My family commented how much prettier it is compared to the original. Aesthetically  speaking, it is one of the best looking speakers on the market. Regarding voice recognition, Alexa easily understands all members of my family, even my youngest, who has delays in articulation. Overall it’s a well made, sturdy, compact, and useful product.

We love Alexa in our house! This new Echo has been the perfect addition to our devices. The speaker is loud enough to fill our open living/dining/kitchen space easily. It is also a great quality sound. A great improvement from prior generations.  I love how the devices can sync up with each other to play music and other things throughout the house. I also am quite fond of the intercom feature. Some of our kids are downstairs so now I don't have to yell down the stairs to get their attention! The only shortcoming is Alexa not always have the answers we may be looking for. She gets better and better every day, though. Not much of a complaint. The look is very sleek and fits easily in any space with the different color options.

The echo is pretty nice. I bought this primarily for music I dont too much care about the other bells and whistles. The sound quality is great. Bass is pretty good to for a single speaker. I like to voice functions although it doesnt understand something at least a few times a day. I'm super disappointed in the paid Amazon music app though. Not at all intuitive, user friendly, or fun to operate. I'm considering returning the echo for a google home. Google has an excellent music app. Most of my family has the echo so I'm trying to stick with it but.. idk. I'm annoyed daily by that damn music app.

Line-in audio turns off on its own when watching TV/Movies. When audio becomes too quiet, the Echo turns off the line-in and will not return unless there is a large boost in audio, or on the app it is switched to line-out and then back to line-in. **Confirmed with support staff: "the line-in was NOT intended to support constant audio-in. When the Echo Studio CAN and DOES support constant audio-in. The Echo 3rd Gen line-in was meant for playing MP3 devices that don’t have Bluetooth on the Echo."** This seems to be a software based issue that could be fixed, but so far it has not been and is supposedly going to be happening to Echo Studio as well. PS. Sound quality is great

We love our echo when it is working properly. The sound is very good. However,  the echo turns off randomly and doesn't respond to commands.  We listen to a lot of audiobooks.  When asking for audiobooks it has a hard time playing books that are in my library.  For example I'll say "Alexa play magic tree house books 9-16" it does not recognize the book in audible. But instead play a previous book of the same time that it has played numerous times.  It's very frustrating. I have had to unplug it many times because it skips and does not recognize anything. And I've only had it for maybe 2 months.

Setup was far easier than the Gen 1 Echo or the Gen 2 Echo Dots.  It immediately detected our home Wireless network, logged in because the password was already registered with our current Echo setup, and only required some minor customization (change the name and location in the Alexa App).  Speaker sounds better than the Gen 1 Echo too.

I don’t like that Alexa plays the wrong thing after she repeats exactly what i ask of her. It’s really weird. I also don’t like that we have to pay an extra monthly fee to listen specific music from amazon music when you pay all this money for the product you still have to pay extra to enjoy it. Also she was programmed to my voice yet still she listens to everyone who calls her name.
Very upset. I bought new echo 3rd gen. However, it's an inferior quality product. No sound no light on. Ask customer service to replace a new one. Do they test this device before leaving factory?

I love my Alexa device, I use her for music, my alarm, weather and entertainment. She responds pretty well however at times the device doesnt respond to me saying alexa. However the noise quality is well, and overall really enjoy my alexa! Shes also super entertaining and funny, especially when asked to sing to me. I would highly recommend buying this product I'd you're interested!

We needed something in our livingroom with a bit better sound quality than our existing Echo Dot. This certainly filled the requirement nicely. If you don't need the built in hub included in the more expensive model then this is a good choice. We moved our existing Dot into a room we did not care about sound, which worked out nicely

Wont work without cellphone app and only gives error messages.  Have spent hours on this.  I have another one and it was easy to set up but this one which makes you use iPhone or iPad, would not load.  Also, said the app was not compatible with my iPad!  Better start ironing out the kinks here.  So many people have the same trouble.

I won this in a raffle, I love my new friend! She plays music, answers questions and entertains the grand kids☺️ What I don’t like is my 4 year old grand daughter ordered music I didn’t want or need. I wish there was a passcode one needed to complete a transaction. Good news I was able to cancel easily. Amazon is great in this area👍🏽

I purchased it because it worked with jw.org and it seems to work well. I have been surprised how handy it is to have when I’m curious about the weather or wanting to listen to a channel on SiriusXM. It’s jokes are a little corny but it usually makes me laugh. The notification feature when Amazon delivers a package is also quite convenient

The only downside to this product is I didn't buy it sooner. The sound quality is great for music and the voice recognition is spot on. I listen to music constantly and usually at a loud volume when I am home alone, Alexa still picks up my voice even speaking at a normal level. I have a pretty strong southern accent and it has no problem deciphering what I am trying to say. I would recommend this product to everyone.

This device is EVERYTHING I was hoping for and more. It looks great. Sounds awesome! I have the original Echo Dot. I think most would agree you can’t use that for any serious music playing. I then purchased an Echo Input so that I could hook it up to any serious speaker system. But I wanted something all inclusive. This fits the bill. I’m completely happy with this purchase and I have been telling my family and friends to get one too!

Sound quality us good given the size of the unit. Voice recognition is pretty consistent. The utility is great. For ne the ability to create and populate lusts hands free as needed items occur to me is priceless. The fact that I can access the print version of the list thru the app on my phone when out and about is icing on the cake.

We have a echo dot and I thought this upgrade would be a great Christmas.  I expected the sound to be much better than it is.  From the beginning we have had problems setting it up and it stops playing music a couple times a day.  The ECHO DOT keeps playing on the same internet connection and the ECHO 3rd gen stops.  It may be going back.

I wanted a second Echo for a bedroom to be able to play Amazon unlimited music.  I have to say the sound quality on this one is much better than my original Echo.  Much deeper, richer sound.  Got this as a Black Friday deal, so even better.  Love that it was fairly easy to move my smart plugs to it without much of an issue.  Happy with it.

The Echo hears & understands like a human! Seriously, it’s blazing quick to respond and puts out great sound. One caveat: my residence is entirely wireless. While I can put several Echo devices online at once, all on the same network, they will not sync, I.e., play stereo using two devices. My network uses link isolation for WiFi security. Bluetooth will only work for a few minutes before it loses connection. I’m looking for a workaround in the form of computer to router to access point—Mac OS, arrrgh, won’t set up wireless internet sharing from a wireless network. Amazon’s support for these devices is an absolute waste of time, lots of time.

She malfunctions when I'm using the microwave, but, otherwise, is great. I've rapidly grown accustomed to having Alexa. Routines are magical. I say, "alexa, good morning" and she gives me a fun fact, tells me the weather, and anything on my agenda for the day. I ask questions, play music, get recipes, keep lists... Alexa is wonderful. My 4 year old child and my 60 year old bff also love her. So, she's not age dependent.

My wife and kids have seen this at friends and family's homes recently, and were very excited to invite Alexa into the house.  We also have 2 "dots" for the kids rooms, and Alexa is great a playing them bedtime music.  She is currently taking a break from controlling lights, as the X-mas decorations have come down.  However setting that up after everything was opened was quite simple. -Shawn

I purchased the Echo to go with 3 of the echo dots I purchased earlier this year,  I am still learning all of the things that Alexa can do.  The sound from the Echo is very clear, when playing music I can't tell any doffernce from when we have our stereo on.  The design of the Eho is very nice and looks great on my kitchen island,

I love it to easily play music I enjoy and change the volume.  It was a gift intended to help me keep track of medications for a short time period.  It worked beautifully for that.  I like it so much I ordered the Dot for another room. Think I need another Dot now.

I love the speaker and the sound is excellent. My only problem is when I purchased prime music I put it on my Echo Dot and Now that i’ve purchased the GEN three speaker prime music will not work with my GEN three. Unless I give the command to Echo Dot.  So I have to go through Echo Dot in order to play prime music on both devices . Alexa said I had to purchase prime music again for the new speaker. But if I go through Echo Dot  then it works on both speakers. But I love it it’s great Music!  I’m having a blast with it.

My daughter got me Alexa for Christmas and I love it. I listen to music while I'm working and the quality of the sound is great. I'm always making a list for one thing or another and Alexa is great for helping me keep track of everything.
