I like how all I have to do is tell her to add something to a particular list and she does it.When I am ready to write down the list I just for it and she will tell me everything on it. Best Christmas present ever

I mostly use this device for music. It’s quality of sound is better than most stereos I’ve had over the years which amazed me at first. Now I’m just spoiled by it. I do have other echo devices. I have them linked through my amazon app, I use them to play music throughout my home - I am not super tech savvy - but I was able to follow the easy instructions in my Alexa app to link them together to play music together. I also have several smart plugs and I use them via the Alexa to turn off and on lights in the house - and all I have to say is “Alexa turn on the bedroom lamp” - I can’t say enough about echos. This one in particular is definitely worth it.

I like the convenience of listening to ANY music on voice command!! That was my main reason for purchasing Alexa Echo 7. I like the alarm for waking up with your favorite song or radio station for the news. The connection with your phone is great because you can call any of your contacts hands free. I really am glad that I purchased this awesome device! Thank you for making it easy to text or call you when ever I have a question and being able to do so 24/7!!

My daughters bought me an Alexa for a Christmas present. I did not want one. Now I absolutely love it!  I can turn my lights on and off and listen to whatever music I'm in the mood for. I know there is so much I can do but haven't had the time lately to check everything out. But I do love my Alexa, it was the perfect gift!

I was disappointed by the sound . I have the 2nd generation and it actually sounds better than this one . This one has less bass , less treble and is not as loud . ( even after tweaking the equalizer ) If you are looking to replace your last gen ... don’t . If you are purchasing this as your first : it’s ok . Disappointed.

From the first generation echo I had. They have certainly Improved on the echo. I do miss being able to turn the top to adjust the volume. But overall sound quality and voice recognition have improved a lot for me. I like the fact that I can have an external aux cable as well if I need it. Overall I’ve been pleased with it.

very hard to get it up and working.access to get the app.you had to go thru Microsoft to get to it and that was a problem I still don't have the app. other people I know who have this also said it was really bad getting it programed other wise it seems good so far.just don't know how we got it working but will try to get app. again later. need a tech. support contact to get thru this problem.

There is nothing I dislike.  I love how I can tell it to change the tempature in the house, play music, turn lights and fireplace off and on.  Asking questions is the best and savings appointments in my calendar. I even use it to make up my grocery list so I don't have to type it.  So many other things but too many to name.

Works very well. It is not very often it does not understand me. Overall it is a great unit. I have one in each of my bedrooms. The expensive part is getting all the sensors that That you needed to operate Alexa. Each light fan and whatever needs its own receiver. If you can do the electrical part you can save a lot of money by not having to hire it out.

What this item for my fiance for Christmas received the first one and would not connect to Wi-Fi set on the phone for 45 minutes with a customer service rep still couldn't get it to work got them to send me another one had the same issue with the new one this time customer service was out of India could barely understand that customer service rep and she was very rude I will be returning the second one I'm done with these

I really like this speaker.  Sounds great for being so small. I have 3 second generation and 1 3rd gen. To be honest I can’t tell the difference between the two. I think they both sound good.  Great to hook up for multi room group. Work on cleaning the whole house and have them playing in all the rooms at the same time.

I received as a Christmas gift and was a little leery I must admit.  So far so good as the set up is super easy.  I am getting more comfortable with it and so far so good.  The sound when playing music is awesome.  Occasionally, I get a bit nervous about it's capability, but I'm sure I'll get used to it and use it more.

Love the new unit , as always it’s not that easy to connect all speakers at the same time. They will all play at the same time but I must repeat the command too many time and sometimes I give up in frustration. I own 5 Alexas and would consider other other products but not so sure of the investment is worth it. Would like to try them before I had to pay for them.

The product is tons better than the original dot.. they shouldn’t really be compared. But the bass is seriously lacking.. I have a similar speaker in size of this one, and the bass response is much better on that one. Outside of this for lower volume listening like at a desk, or while cooking, this is wounderful! On a side note, I tried to measure the response, it seems that anything below a certain Hz is cut. So the low bass is almost muted.

One of the most fun smart speakers I've owned. This is my first alexa device and boy was I blown by the level at which alexa has reached. With all the smart skills and the 'even better' stupid skills, I have become a fan. Whispering is one cool feature, I just talk to it in whispers now. One thing that I would love to see in the future is able to set a custom word to wake alexa up. I would also want a 'beast mode' or savage mode that would make alexa super sassy like if I ask it who is better, google home or echo it should say 'you think you can get someone better than me? ANSWER IS A BIG NO' and stuff like that. I also wish that I could use stereo mode through bluetooth with ANY speaker rather than just with the same type of speaker, but what I have here is GOLD! love it !

I love that I can tell Alexa to add something to my shopping list, ask her the temperature outside or the forecast for any city, put something on calendar and remind me about it, set a timer, talk Pikachu to my granddaughter, play music for her (or me), tell me when someone is at the front door, etc.  Very cool and so handy to have.

This one doesn't make that sound when you say ALEXA, So is it supposed to?  My other one does, but I have the top of the line one.  I don't know if there is a difference in a newer version or not, so I just don't know if ALEXA hears me cuz I am waiting for that prompt sound after I say ALEXA, but it never happens.

Adquiri tres alexas, una para el auto el cual complicó el reconocimiento de app Spotify, en la echo show 8 el cual fue un obsequio para un adulto mayor, no le entendía al hablar o debía casi gritar para ser escuchado, me parece deberían permitir subir la recepción de sonido de los micrófonos, así como crear skills ajustadas a este segmento, en la mía echo he extrañado que le he efectuado varias consultas que fácilmente tienen respuestas en Google pero simplemente responde que desconoce la respuesta, me parece en esa parte si me ha decepcionado, pero como usuario nuevo sigo experimentando y espero prontas actualizaciones del software que mejore y amplíe las prestaciones actuales para nuestra satisfacción y lealtad a la marca.

I have had each generation of the Echo, and it gets better with each evolution.  The sound quality over the 2nd Gen is clearly noticeable (better bass and overall quality).  Alexa reads to me every night from my Audible library.  I highly recommend this unit.  My only hope is the next gen has a clock face on it.

We got this to add more sound to our house (we have echos in most of our rooms now, but most of them are dots, and we wanted some richer sound in the livingroom.  This is certainly better than the dot, but our echo show in the kitchen has better sound, and I was a bit surprised by that.  Still like this though.

It constantly has to be unplugged and plugged back in to get it to work.  It can be working fine and all at once just stop for no reason.  I have to unplug and the plug back in to get it to start back up.  It also will on occasion start playing the information garbled -- again the only solution is the unplug/plug back in solution.

Finally this generation unit supports audio in on the Auxiliary port. it solved two problems, an Alexa device and a much needed decent speaker for a Monitor I have hooked up to an Apple TV!  Sound quality beats 2nd gen hands down, so much so I am considering a second unit to sync it to for stereo sound in my office.
I updated from my echo fist generation to this one. To be honest I trade in my Ins one and now with this one I’m totally regret the change , not significantly changes besides the look.

First day after delivery we found out that it stops playing after 20 minutes or less and at times it stops in the middle of a song.  Tried customer support service and it was a nightmare to get them to understand the problem and rectify it.  After several phone calls and emails they agreed to send us a new unit...we are waiting.  Returning the defective unit was another saga I do not wish to pile on

So I had a little echo dot and I loved it, but it was kind of quiet and the sound quality wasn't very good if I wanted to play music.  So I found my new Echo gen 3 for $25 off and thought I'd try it.  OMG, I love it.  The sound quality is amazing and it's so much more responsive to commands.  You should upgrade now.

Sound quality is 10x better than echo dot, and voice recognition has improved a lot since the 1st gen. While playing music at max volume, this 3rd Gen Echo will hear me say “Alexa” without making me yell (which is a problem I have with my 1st Gen Echo). If you rely on Alexa to wake you up, I can guarantee you won’t sleep through the alarm on this Echo!
Gave it to my father in a senior apartment, placed it in a open faced tv stand. Sounds like an old schooled HK receiver. A+

I like the sound that comes from this tiny speaker. I have three Gen 2 and one Gen 3. I have them grouped together so there all playing throughout the house while cleaning. I play classic rock/80's/ & hair metal. they sound good for being so small. I have a lot of alexa devices, so these are awesome for me.

I have all types of Amazon Echo products, including dots and subwoofers that have better response then this item. I'm talking about voice command pick up. Overall sound quality is decent but was not really thrilled with the lack of response.

The sound quality is nowhere near as good as a Bose, but it’s really good for the price! The bass is a little lacking in carrying power (can’t really fill a room very well) but it has impressive close range depth and warmth. I’ve only had the arch 3rd gen for a few weeks and haven’t had much time to pair other devices/services with it, but what I have done so far has been easy and seamless. All in all a great product for a relatively reasonable price.

This was basically a plug and play set-up since I purchased it connected to my Amazon account. It even connected itself to my wi-fi since I had already downloaded the Alexa app to my phone. It is very easy to use and the voice control is very responsive even when playing music quite loud. I am very satisfied with my purchase and plan to add other speakers in the future

So far it is great ... we had an old black thin one and this one has so much better sound and better interaction which must be because it can hear better.  Just need to figure out all we can do with it now.

I decided to upgrade to a newer version. I had two gen 1 echos which were still working well. I thought I would trade them in since these were on sale. They came a day earlier than expected and were very easy to set up. I like them as well as I liked the gen 1. They hopefully will last as long and as well.

these are way better sounding with more volume than the echo dots! that was an important feature because we like music on our roofed screen  porch which has some outside noise, one being the air conditioner compressor. also nice to sync our front Ring doorbell to and when doing so there is no need to buy a Ring chime !

While the Echo product works well, with great sound, as it is playing music it will occasionally shut off, go dead and I have to unplug and restart the process. I tried on three occasions talking to to Alexa after she stopped but nothing, no lights etc. Unplug and restart, wondering if  anyone else experienced this?
Replaced an Echo Dot with this in a Master Bathroom and ROCKED this end of the apartment.  Has the same guts as the Echo Plus but in smaller size but I don't detect any loss in audio quality.

It’s a Echo Plus speaker without the hub and temperature at a lower price but the speaker and sound are the same. To me that’s a win - win plus sound at a lower price. I don’t care about the hub and temperature, just sound quality and functionality and the new Echo is a winner.  I want to buy another.

Well, it's just sort of creepy, in a way. I like it because I can ask for weather info, order up music..that IS fun. But, when I'm sitting in the living room talking with my hubs and Echo lights up for no apparent reason during conversation, it just feels weird. We turned off the mic but, shrug..

This one is working much better than my old one, SO FAR...Lots of base tones, almost every song...But it does work...Does not play the same tunes as my old one, lots of songs I never heard of before...Same groups. older tunes..??? Classical rock is one area, most tunes not heard before...Just keep on going forward, easy to do with my remote...
I’ve only had it for a week. Consequently, I’m still on the “learning curve”. I find something new every day and am really enjoying the experience!

I bought 3 of these to replace my Echo Dots due to the larger size speakers. Unfortunately, they seem to have a few bugs that need worked out. For some reason, they do not pair to the internet as well as the Echo Dots do. They are constantly going offline and need to be reconnected. Amazon needs to fix this issue with some software updates or something

Comparing this to my old Echo Dot, the sound quality is certainly better.  But it seems that I have to speak louder for this Echo to get the message.  Also, the old Dot does very well with Follow-Up mode, but this Echo seems to shut down faster.  I often have to re-awaken Alexa for a follow-on request.

I love this item it so nice to tell it a song to play and it plays it. Also when you wake up you can say Alexa what’s today’s news and it starts playing the news when you set it up you can tell it which news station you want to here. You can always ask it what the weather is going to be today and for the rest of the week. There are to many things that it does to write about.

I purchased this as a Black Friday deal and am glad I did. I needed a second Alexa for my bedroom and this is perfect. I only wish they still had the woodgrain option. My first Alexa has this and I really enjoy how it looks. Otherwise, there is not much else to say. I liked the price and it works perfectly.

I like the product and many of its options. I don’t like that the voice is hard to understand. One or two words no problem but sentences are muddy. I’ve trie all the sound settings but is still not clear. Overall though I really like the product. Music is good and clear it’s just the voice that isn’t.
We traded up and we like the new Echo.  We were without an Echo for about 6 months and we missed Alexa.  The sound is much better and the content seems more extensive.

Works great by itself.  This product and the other echo and show products are NOT user friendly.  When hooking up multiple units they just don't seem to want to interact very well. They either get confused, don't respond, or only some speakers will play music when you've told the system to play everywhere. Sometimes it works and other times it doesn't. It's about a 30% failure rate in that aspect. The Alexa firmware needs improvements.  I'll give Amazon another 12 months and if I don't see drastic changes in terms of fluidity I'll be considering a change to Google's system. Get it together Amazon!

Great product. Great sound quality. Ascetically appealing. Works with all my smart home devices. Connects everything together. Overall great purchase. BUT there is one thing I don't like about it. This thing is a speaker. A smart speaker at that. Someone like me with an iPhone cant just open their apple music and click a song and play it over the speaker. Which to me doesn't make sense. But other then that i love it.

My only complaint is that it has to be linked to two devices and those two devices have to be right and left speakers. So when I have my two echoes in different rooms but the sub in the room I use most, it doesn’t work. Since one speaker is forced to be setup as left and the other right, when paired with the sub

quality, efficiency, and knowledge are what I like about my new Alexa's.  I have one in every large room of the house, as I have a large house!  Sounds great! Especially helpful with weather and shopping lists.  I love the music also!  Thank You for such an outstanding assistant! Sincerely, DN

This unit is much improved over my first generation Echo, although I do miss the volume ring that was on the original. Voice recognition and the ability of it to hear you over music is much, much better.  Sound quality is also improved, but it goes from good to amazing sound when you pair it with another echo for stereo sound. I paired it with a 2nd gen. Echo plus and it just sounds great! I may add the echo sub at some point but it really doesn't need it once paired and in stereo.

The 3rd gen Echo has way better bass than the 3rd gen Dot that I purchased. The reason for three stars is because it lacks mid range sound and at 4 rimes the cost of the Dot I feel it should have better sound quality. Knowing this after the fact, I would have bought four Dots and placed them in different rooms.

This thing is awesome! I got the echo and two dots for my kids rooms. Its great. I can set individual reminders for each child. I can send reminders from my cell when im working.  Kids love asking questions and listening to music.its great. I can shut off forgotten lights from my cell. Its great...

I already have a couple Echo Dots in my house. I added this one to provide better sound when listening to music. What a great addition to our house. And when I turn all my Alexa devices on together to listen to music, the whole house fills with the sound. I'm planning on getting another big Alexa like this one to add even more great music to our house.

I bought this and was not sure I really wanted it. I mostly wanted a speaker to stream my music while I worked... but oh my god. Alexa is my new love (sorry Siri). One thing I love is how she can add things to my shopping or to-do lists so easily and it goes right into the app. This helps when I lay awake at night unable to sleep because I know I need to make a list of things to do the next day... so I can get it quickly off my mind and go to bed. Well, I loved it so much I bought 2 echo dots. One for the kitchen and one for the kids room so now I can easily drop into the kids room and let them know dinner is ready without having to march up the stairs or scream like a banshee.

I just love it! I am French with a very strong accent. I was concerned that Alexa would not be able to get what I ask for. I have absolutely no problem. Anything I ask is understood right away. I just love that Echo! In term of the sound, I wish I could change the bass. Otherwise, I'm very happy with my new gadget.

I've been a echo owner since the 1st gen... this thing is garbage compared to the 1st gen. Yes, sound quality is way better but it crackles and pops when waking her. It sounds broken, flat out. Tech support says this is normal. Nope, 1st gen did not do this garbage. That's not even the worst part. I use my echos as my preliminary music listening devices. I pay a premium for unlimited and HD music from Amaxon. Both of the latest gen echos I bought randomly disconnect ALL THE TIME and randomly stop playing music for no reason. They're supposed to be new tech, but honestly the 1st gen worked way more flawlessly. Major bugs and kinks that I have zero faith in Amazon addressing before they shove the newest gen dow your throat.

I was given this as a gift, never asked for it and never wanted it. I’m not a lazy person so for me taking the time to turn in music or the lights or changing the temp is not a task. Alexa really isn’t anything special. So unless someone likes having a device which spies on them I wouldn’t bother.

Cannot reliably playback purchased music in my iTunes library that exists inside my iPhone.  It seems to ONLY want to stream music from Amazon Music and other streaming services.  I returned this and bought a simple blue-tooth speaker which works perfectly fine.  Does not seem to play nice at all with Siri/iPhone.

Far better sound than my old Echo Dot (which is now in another room - for playing lower quality music there).  Easy to set up and sounds great.  I also got the battery base for it so I can unplug from power and take out onto the deck and patio when I want my Alexa and music to go.  Nice system.

I replaced an Echo dot with this. The bass has a "tubby" quality to it: a mid-bass hump or two that comes up short of what I was hoping for in terms of sound quality. Re-positioning doesn't seem to help so it's definitely a manufacturing/tuning issue. Otherwise it works fine as an Alexa device.

Decided to take the plunge and get an Echo on black friday deal.  I was a bit dubious of how useful it would be, and the jury is still out on that.  Maybe once I hook it up to a bunch of smart devices, its utility will become clearer.  For now, I am impressed with the amount of tech, voice recognition, sound quality in a small package, that you can for a relatively low price.  So far, I'm not disappointed with the purchase.

I purchased this to replace my echo dot because I wanted better sound.  This speaker really delivered.  It has a full sound with very good bass.  As a bonus, it seems Alexa can hear me better too. Setup was amazingly easy.  I pulled the speaker out of the box and plugged it in.  It seemed to already know my home network.

The sound quality is really great at this price point - not to mention that once initially paired w/ the app it’s all voice control from there.  There are better speakers out there for sure, and at varying prices, quality and features...but for everything this is, it simply cannot be beat on sale for only 80 bucks!!!  This replaces my Echo dot paired with an Oontz speaker, and I’m also giving 2 as gifts this year now that I know how awesome it is.
I have an Echo Dot, which I replaced with this...….Just plugged it up and it was all set.....Could not have been easier to connect...…..Great product!

I’m really impressed with the quality of the speaker(s).  Way better than my Bose portable or JBL.  And soooo easy to set up & use.  Alexa is very helpful.  BUT, yesterday I had asked Alexa to wake me up at 6:30 am to happy music.  The music was happy but it was 4:30 AM.  It was a very long day :-(

Really the same as the other Echos - I needed another one and black Friday was on.... comparing the sound to the tall Echo, 1st Gen, the sound quality is better. I am happy with it. I would like to purchase the Echo with the deeper bass but it will have to wait until Prime Day in the summer.

So far I have been using it only for music emails questions Etc. The one that I have now it was a Christmas gift from my son in 2019. Right at this moment I'm going to purchase another one myself. Thank you for asking. About to durability off this item I don't know yet it is too soon to tell.

I have the 1st gen Echo at home, and I use it as a voice assistant as well as a music speaker to stream my playlist on Spotify. I didn't feel like the audio quality of gen 1 Echo is bad at all until I got this 3rd gen Echo. The audio quality improved a lot. Since I have another 5 Echo Dots (3rd gen) at home, I can now enjoy the whole home audio feature by grouping them up. Nice job, Amazon
EASE TO SET UP. YOU CAN TALK IN DIFFERENT LANGUAJES, 100% RECOMENDED

We are loving it. I never thought I would want one but I love playing music on it. Also we check weather conditions. So easy. Still learning what this device can do.  Alexa is very patient and my Grandkids are getting a kick out of teaching me weird sounds.  This was a Christmas gift to us.

My Echo system was a gift and I'm not used to it as yet. It is great to be able to ask for just about any artist or music. But it does things—random sounds and pulsing lights—that I do not understand and I do NOT have the time to "explore" a household device! Alexa may be smarter than I need it to be....
This device doesn’t work periodically and will randomly make beep noises.  Reset it and still continues to do the same stuff

We love it we have the echo dot also in many rooms of the house I like that I can call it or do an announcement and I can get everyone to come to 1 room or you can play music across the house with them we truly enjoy the fact we can connect to Sirius xm and listen to music we have found sleeping to the xm spa setting make sleeping amazing. It is a must have

This has been the hardest echo device to set up & I've tried everything to set up bluetooth with my phone. Which was a breeze with my other 3 devices. I don't get what I'm missing with this one, but all advice I've found online has been useless. May return if it doesn't pair with my phone!

I got this to upgrade an area in a large room from an Echo Spot to something with a better speaker. This is exactly what I was looking for. The sound is richer and fuller and fills the open space better. I moved the Echo Spot to a bedroom instead and this Echo is perfect in an open concept space.

Everything is great; the one thing I regret though of not getting the echo studio is that I thought that this echo plus had a its own battery source, knowing that now its a better investment to go with the studio rather than going for the echo plus. Now if you are on a budget but want to start using Alexa this one nails it. Excellent sound quality very powerful speaker.

This speakers is awesome i set it up in my room on my desk where my gaming setup is and the speaker is so nice to have, for music, take a call without my phone, also control stuff if you set it up. I got 2 pairs of led's, one under my desk, & one on the back of my Tv that's on the wall and they work great using your voice with Alexa. The speakers surprised me on how much Bass and how good it would play the high's and lo's so, I had to order another Echo lol so I can pair them on my desk & use them as Computer Speakers or just have them for a surround sound and stereo system. Definitely a nice purchase and they always have some room to improve which I won't doubt they will.

I love my new Echo BUT I wish it came in a metal finish!  I have a lot of dust in my home from living on a dirt road and also have a home full of small, long-haired dogs so having an echo with a CLOTH COVER is far from ideal! I anticipate having difficulty keeping this Echo clean!  I'll update as time goes by.

the  Echo 3 is attractive, unobtrusive and has great sound.  I hoped to use it for background music in my office waiting room but it keeps turning off every few hours.  I can't find anything online that helps me fix the problem - I am told it's my connection but multiple other internet connected devices are having no issues.  Same with Amazon help.  Someone said there was  a firmware upgrade but I've not found it.

We have had an echo dot for a long time and used it in our kitchen, mostly for music. We wanted the full size Echo for better sound quality in such a big space. The sound quality is definitely better, but half the time it will shut off in the middle of playing or start to get a fuzzy, static sound. Also, the blue ring will just keep spinning so you can't even give commands to Alexa and ultimately we have to unplug it and restart (which is very inconvenient and annoying). Overall, a good product in theory, but seems to have a lot of glitches.

Echo device arrived in a shipping envelope, which worried me, but thankfully there was no damage to the device and it works exactly as designed. This is a noticeable upgrade from the first generation Echo. The third generation responds much quicker and keeps a steady and reliable connection with my wifi. Highly recommended!

First buyer and user of such a product. Very easy set up. Outstanding sound quality for music. I bought this one for in my bedroom to try it out during our kitchen remodel. So impressed I am keeping it in the bedroom and buying another one. Installed smart switch and the unit picked it up and works turning lights on and off.

I really Like the voice control and asking questions. Music plays well, wish it was a little louder, but not bad. What I don't Like it she makes noises when I don't Want her to. If I haven't Talked to her she will make noises to remind me she’s there. I know You’re there Alexa, sometimes let me have my quiet time. I am Glad I purchased Alexa.  I would Like to however rename her, but can’t find that’s an option.

Constantly turns off or cuts in and out (and no it’s not our internet). Eventually it just stops responding to our voice at all and the only way to get it to work is to unplug it for a few seconds and then plug it back in to reset it. We have to unplug it several times a week, some times even a couple times a day.

I am hearing impaired with hearing aids. This unit has absolutely poor sound quality. Could not distinguished the broadcasted speech. After much frustration,  donated to a day care center classroom. A better Investment would be into a separate speaker combined with the smaller echo dot.
We had an Echo Dot but upgraded it. This one is awesome!!  The sound is way better then the dot. We love it!  Very happy we upgraded.

It was easy to set up. We don't have but one "smart" device set up but it's fun to play with. At this point it's just a toy. Amazon had an offer for new Echo buyers for a 99cent smart plug which we took advantage of. We're using it for our living room table lamp. Like I said, it's fun!

Works great!  Answers questions, tells jokes, and plays music. Times your lights off and on while you’re away. Turns on your bedside lamp when the alarm goes off. Can be programmed for one time, by the day, for weekdays or weekends. Will choose a playlist for you or order from Amazon! Can’t wait to learn more.

The Echo was easy to set up and was working in a matter of minutes. We’re enjoying discovering all it can do. We bought some smart plugs and those too were easy to get up & running. Lots of good music we’re enjoying also. The jokes are pretty corny, which is funny in itself.

Being new to this device, I have not fully utilized the full functions.  Was reasonable easy to set up out of  the box especially for old people like me.  Voice recognition is good, sound is great, and I really like the ability to get Alexis to play any variation of music I request.  Whether by artist, exact song, or general categories.  No more changing of CD's or finding music to play.

Great sound. so great that I ended up replacing my radio with it. The sound is very loud for what it is and its size. Great bass out if it too. Much better than the Echo Dots. This is great for a large area and/or as your primary audio device in a main room. The dots are good for secondary rooms ie. bedrooms.

We have a dot or echo in most every room. I love them for whole house music, but I am having difficulty getting it to recognize the distinct voices in my family. This means that when I asked for my most liked songs, I get my daughter's playlist. I can deal until Lana Del Rey covers Sublime. :(

Nice, now I need one for the other room. Although I paid for upgraded Amazon music, I can’t get any of the music I like on it, so have to look into other subscription services. But it was easy to set up w only one call to customer service. And I am totally hopeless with technology.

It was nice upgrade except it kept saying "something went wrong please try again later" my 1st Gen never did that, also the remote would pair but kept disconnecting and reconnecting making a tone each time waking me up. Sent it back added the 1st Gen back up no issues at all since.

Two more makes three. Easy to order, delivered impossibly quickly, brilliant packaging, east to set up. Whats not to like? Now theres one on each floor of my house, and i can enable "play music everywhere" mode, filling the house with soft music when the mood strikes. I like these!

I love my new echo, as it serves as a great morning partner while  getting ready for my day. I get my  news briefing and weather, as well as get me connected to some good music to get me in a good mood for the day ahead. It is big enough to lend some nice sound, but unobtrusive amongst the toothbrushes, paste, hairbrushes etc. This is an update to our previous echo, the newer one looks much nicer.

I do not own an I- phone or pad or whatever they are called. On line instructions on my Apple computer offer little help , apparently amazon believes everyone is an owner of those devices. I will need to hire someone sophisticated enough to make the connection to the App.I am sure it is a great product however.

This is the second "Alexa" we have purchased. We now have one on each floor of the house. The sound quality is very good, regardless of what musical genre you enjoy. My husband and I are not "techies", but this is a cool device that is easy to operate.  All you need to do is talk.

Easy access to news, information, music and even entertaining jokes. I'm still becoming familiar with all the things I can do with Alexa. I don't have any home functions connected, such as thermostat, lights, etc., so I can't comment on it although it seems to be something handy to have. I was disappointed to not be able to download the app to my phone. It just wouldn't work for some reason. However, I successfully got connected with my laptop.

I had one of the very 1st Echo's, but it did not survive my granddaughter's oops this Christmas. Bought the new one and it's even better !!  The sound quality is great, and the continued new things Alexa can do is also great. She is almost kinda part of the family, as we call her name numerous times every day.

Every single time I ask Alexa to do something she says "there was a problem" and I have to repeat the command it's ridiculous. No it's not my network. I understand we are at the birth of voice command technology but If I purchase it I expect it to do what the description states.

Since I didn't own the previous generations, I have nothing to compare it to.  However, never owning one before, I can honetly say that the sound quality for such a small device is huge.  It also works well with my Harmony Hub to operate nearly everything in my home, on command.

I've had an echo dot for a few years and wanted something with a better speaker system. This does the trick! I listen to my audible books while cleaning the house or cooking dinner and the speaker is loud enough for me to hear over running water in the sink while washing dishes.

I upgraded from 1st Gen.  to the 3rd Gen. due to newer hardware and because the 1st Generation wasn’t working as smoothly. Set up was super easy. If you are up grading, there no need to type in your network info. Because your info is already in your account   The Echo tech that helped me was very patient and worked with me for over 2hrs. He went above and beyond. We tried every situation to hook the 1st Gen to the different groups of speakers. Firgured that there was something wrong with it. Or, it was getting to old. 3rd Gen sounds even better than the original ECHO

Intermittent playback issues plague this device. Amazon replaced the first one, only to have the same issues with the new one. I might just return it and find something else. It’s a shame. Our 2nd and 3rd gen Echo Dots work really well. Hopefully they can work these issues out.

I bought this as an upgrade from my first generation echo.  First of all, aesthetically it is better than the original.  But what really impressed me was the sound quality.  I use my echo to listen to siriusxm radio or music on other streaming sites.  The sound quality is great.  Happy I purchased.

I like this version of Alexa,  the audio sounds great ands the price was perfect.  I have Alexa in control of most IOT electronics in my house and it is very capable at managing these things.  The last few weeks though Alexa will cut out mid sentence or stop listening to me halfway through mine.  Otherwise no complaints,  works good, sounds good,  integrates fairly easily.

We got echo dots for our children, and I knew I had to have one too. Wanted better sound quality and I got it! Love listening to music throughout the day and having much knowledge one voice command away. We haven't yet delved into all Alexa can do, but it's going great so far.

Just love Alexa products.  This is the THIRD Alexa in this home and one Echo Dot too.  The Dot is OK, but no match for sound quality from these Echo devices.  Bought two LED bulbs for the front room, they were a pain to install from that company, but they got us through it and Echo turns on/off and dims the lamps on command.  All devices also tell us if someone is @ the front door.

I like the functionality and Alexa providing "tips" to make operations simpler. At the same time, I just got it so am trying to figure out what commands will allow me to "turn on music with a timer of 8 hours". It seems Alexa may have some difficulty with multiple commands.  She either sets the music or sets the timer, but I haven't been able to get her to understand what I think is a simple "play music for 8 hours" command. Also, the yellow light "notifications" sometimes get caught in a loop with this odd sound until I ask Alexa to play notifications.  I can probably control this in settings.

The sound quality of the speaker is quite amazing considering the size. Alexa's voice is also pleasing. The playlists that are available are just superb. Also, Alexa was able to answer absolutely any question we have asked. Great for local weather forecasts as well.

I set an alarm that didn't go off. I have no way of knowing what I did wrong or if Alexa just didn't understand - even though she repeated back to me what I asked. So no relying on Alexa for alarms, but everything else is great. Excellent sound system good voice recognition.

Great sound quality that fills a room beautifully. Music sounds crisp and bass is perfect. Also, Alexa is pretty awesome. It was a little difficult for me to figure out how everything worked at first, but as you play around in the app, it becomes clearer. Very happy with this purchase!

We had the 2nd Gen for a few years and we loved the volume control twist at the top.  The 3rd Gen does not have that twist control, but the sound quality is much better than the previous Gen.  We do enjoy this product and it is a great value, especially if you pair it with  Fire 4k.

Sound is excellent. Amazon Music Unlimited is the way to go. Endless music selections. Alexa is also fun to "communicate" with. Depending on what you ask and how you ask it you get different answers. I have asked her to marry me three times using a different tone of voice and words. The first response was "Thanks, but I like my current situation". The second was "Sorry, but I think that is against robotic law". Both responses were in kind of a sweet tone. The third response in a stern tone was " It can not be, for you are of the earth and I am of the cloud". My wife is getting jealous of the new woman in my life. LOL

This is an excellent device with great sound quality.  I recently added this to my stable of echo dots and one echo plus.  Fast and easy setup since I already have all of those other Alexas known to my WIFI.  I bought the blue one.  It looks more gray than blue but whatev.

I had a first generation that I really enjoyed however this one is so much better. The speaker quality is excellent. The sound is high quality. Makes listening to my Amazon music play lists very enjoyable! This was given as a gift for Christmas and I am very happy with it.

The sound out of this compact speaker is fantastic. The bass is rich the mid-notes and highlights are clear. It can also be adjusted in the equalizer in the alexa app. I got the twilight blue color and really like it. The only echo speaker that outplays this is the studio.

The sensitive microphones pick up your voice much better than the echo dot. Alexa can hear your commands even if playing loud music.  For its size, this has room filling sound with a nice balance of lows and highs.  Excellent for music playback. Highly recommend this device.

WOW! That is the first thing once i heard the sound quality coming from this new 3rd gen. Echo. A 100% improvement from 2nd gen, and there is nothing terribly wrong with the 2nd gen either, its just the took it up a few levels with the sound on this model. Now I have only had this a few hours, so if my opinion changes which it more than likely wont, or if more things I discover about the new gen. I will try to update.

Not being an audiophile, I do not need the best of the best.  But I have to say, the pairing of these little speakers provides an impressive range of excellent sound in my bedroom.  I would consider the sub woofer, but there is no place to put it.  Very happy camper here.

I replaced a Gen 1 Echo with this new model. The installation was as easy as logging in and it self configured.  I didn't voice train it but I don't have any problems with response. Overall, the sound is a bit softer than the other and the look doesn't stand out. So far I like it.

Traded in my 1st gen model for this one.  Nicer styling, sounds fuller, mics pick up my voice better and further.  Even has a audio in/out jack which 1st gen lacked.  Only con is midrange could be stronger, even after equalizing in the Alexa app.  Overall, very satisfied.

I purchased a dot a year ago as a way to enter into the smart speaker venue. I couldn’t believe how much we ended up using it. My family listens to music a lot, and I thought this would be better to have in the kitchen, which is a larger area. The sound is better than the dot (although I was still impressed with the dot), the bass is deeper and I feel like it has a bigger range. I would recommend this for anyone wanting something a little more than a dot for music.

Indiscutiblemente me enamoro mi Echo alexa es lo mejor que pudieron inventar, buen sonido te ayuda en muchas cosa este aparato me encantó tanto que ya llevo tres comprado, uno para mi hijo uno para mi hermana y el mio😀 de verdad se lo recomiendo totalmente

I bought two of these at a specially discounted price, and my wife and daughter couldn't be happier. My daughter now feels like she has her own stereo system for her room, and my wife has been dancing around the kitchen requesting/singing show tunes - what's not to like?

I've been using my new Alexa to listen to music on Amazon since I set up.  The sound quality can't be beat.  I've used it to listen radio station BBC 94.9 FM in London, UK.  I get current temperatures and weather forecasts using Alexa.  I love my Alexa Echo 3rd generation.

Super sad..... I have about 8 Amazon smart audio devices. Clearly I drink the Alexa koolaid but..... The sound on the echo 3 just sucks.  They got everything else right as an upgrade but the muffled audio is painful to the ears. True shame.  Almost a throwaway :(

It just works.  Alexa is great and she knows it (PS...so does Amazon).  I have a Gen 2 and the sound quality on Gen 3 is much better.  It wasn't bad before, but it's noticeable. Only negative...It'll make you lazy.  I go to my parents house and I have to actually physically turn on a light switch or use a remote control to turn stuff on...I mean the nerve! Any who, you won't regret buying it.  Just make sure to get some smart outlets as well...totally ups her game.

Likes - good interaction with Amazon account IE - playing music   -Excellent sound quality   -Very easy to set up and use, Dislikes - tries to sell me more stuff   - limited AI more like a good voice search tool with links to Amazon features and plug in home apps. Good value for price, I was hoping for a higher level  of AI, still a good tool, particularly with the Amazon interface

Bought this on black friday. I upgraded from Echo - Gen 1. I must say its smaller and better. I love the looks with fabric exterior instead of plastic body. I definitely feel difference in sound and base. The Amazon Smart Plug was freebie which i plan to use for table lamp. Love this.

I am a big fan of Echo/Alexa devices. They make my life so much easier. I sync my Ring cameras and house lights up with Alexa. I also love linking all my Echos to play the same music in all room’s I move around the house a lot and and listing to music seamlessly is nice.

Finally decided to trade in my 1st-gen Echo for this one, and wow was I surprised.  The sound is a bit crisper and cleaner when compared to the older model, and the added bass was much needed and really puts out for such a small speaker.  Seems to work just as well or better than the 1st-gen models with any functions or apps I use.  Definitely satisfied with this purchase.

We had a lot of trouble getting her to connect to Spotify and Apple Music instead of Amazon Music. We gave up after a bit and tried again after an update and then it worked. The echo also gives you a lot of ads after using an app, and we have to constantly tell her to stop even though we have tried to set preferences to have that feature off. Also, the app glitches a lot.

I received this as a present, and so far have mostly basic services with it. I think it will be more useful the more I learn, but am using it quite a bit now. The only fault I see at this point is it's ability to recognize what you are asking for if you don't always use the precise term it is looking for. For example, when I receive a message on it, and try to delete it after heard, if I say delete message- it refers me to the help on my Alexa app. But if I say delete notifications, then it will happily delete it without further actions on my part. It needs to know that a message and notification is the same. Very happy with it so far!

Great upgrade from previous versions. Tech support is lacking severely. When calling you get indian support that is extremely basic. The speaker itself is great high treble and low bass not too big and not too small. Looks great in any setting with the color options.

Frrequently shouts out that its connected to my computer. Returning this until an option is added to turn this ANNOYING "feature" can be turned off in Settings. Amazon has known about it for years now, and hasn't lifted a finger. Whoever put it on the Echo should be fired.

I have become a raving fan of Amazon’s Alexa. I am fussy about sound quality and can say this latest model is an improvement.  I love it.  I also own the latest dot which I use in my bedroom.  Definitely the larger Echo has better sound quality but J love them both.

We got a black friday deal on the Echo 3rd gen and are happy with it for the price we paid.  It sounds good and is easy to set up like all other amazon products.  My only complaint is that Alexa is behind Siri and Google when it comes to understanding questions and responding correctly.

This product is excellent.  Such a great sound.  I only listen to music with my Alexa.  I also have her in my car.  I will get rid of Sirius radio, as I have many playlists.  The problem is that I'm too dependent on using Alexa.  I have one in each of my rooms in my house.  Fantastic product!!

Purchased myself a Christmas gift when it was on sale.  I am enjoying deciding the type of music to listen to, and the convenience of turning on my chair-side lamp without having to get up.  (I purchased a smart plug combo.)  I love the blue color, as well.  Color options were a smart marketing decision...

I have 2 Echo Dots and love them.  Wanted to step up to 3rd generation and expected better for the price paid.  My Echo Dot responds much faster and hears more accurately than the pricier model.  I have the Echo in the exact same spot that my Echo Dot was in.  I struggle with Alexa.  I love the idea of a better speaker as we do play a lot of music but not impressed yet.

I love this and all of my echoes.  I travel with them and give them as gifts now.  My 99 year old Mom was really struggling with the streaming music concept - we tried everything and everything frustrated and upset her, until I finally convinced her to let me get her one.  She has access to music she hasn’t been able to find in decades.  She plays her music all day - and now she’s having fun asking questions, jokes, etc.  Next we’ll get her to start using it to order from Prime.  Thank you!

I’ve had her for 2 months now and she is great. Connects to my tv, Xbox, sound system and she does great. I did have my doubts in the beginning but they are all gone. Voice recognition is amazing she recognizes everything I say, knows exactly what song to look up if I don’t know the name but the artist, or vice versa, I recommend

I love the easy, plug and play setup on this speaker!  I have some older echo dots, but wanted a clearer sound, and this speaker delivers!  It took me less than 2 minutes to set up the speaker and connect it to my wi-fi.  The sound is a HUGE improvement over the dots!

When linked to my Samsung TV via Bluetooth, there is about a 1/2 sec delay between the picture and the sound. The TV has an audio delay adjustment for "compatible audio devices". Apparently this device is not compatible.  It's too bad because the sound is amazing.

The speaker is really convenient but incredibly glitchy. It uses a lot of bandwidth so it will cause the WiFi to slow or stop completely. It recognizes voice commands readily but will fail to follow instructions about 20% of the time. Also, I have to restart it often because the sounds turns to static while I’m streaming video. It may be that I got a defective unit, and I would probably buy it again, but I won’t expect it to be exactly what I’d hoped for.

I love my Alexa! The sound quality of this speaker is great. It doesn’t sound crackly when you turn it up all the way. The voice commands work perfectly especially with other devices connected like my smart bulbs, switches, & even my Roku tv! I have an echo dot as well & they work great paired up so that I can listen to music in multiple rooms at the same time. 2020 is cool 😎

I mine as well throw out my other blue tooth speakers. This one sounds better, voice recognition works well, and with Amazon music it plays anything I want to hear. I’m planning on getting a second one to put on the other side of the room or maybe for the garage.
This one replaced my original Echo. At once, I was surprised at the improvement in sound. Definitely it's a value to buy.

The Echo makes random noise 24/7 so I have to unplug it to sleep. It does occasionally act correctly as a timer. I wouldn't trust it to be an alarm clock or do anything automatically.  I have owned an Echo that worked for a few years, so this is a disappointment.

I received my Alexa as a Christmas gift and I love it! I had been wanting one for a long time! I love being able to play music just by asking Alexa and the thunderstorm sounds is so relaxing! I know there’s much more you can do with it and I intend to try it all!

This is our fourth or fifth Alexa product and it’s the most responsive yet. We use this in the bathroom for music in the shower- and it’s the first one that I don’t have to yell outside of the shower to get it to skip a song. Amazing sound. Very good value for the price!
Alex can hear me better when I say her name over music or noise. I don’t have to speak louder which is nice.  Better sound than my 1st generation.

Love our new Echo! We upgraded from the smaller Echo Dot b/c we read the sound was better in the Echo. My son listens to music through it all the time. Setup was extremely simple and as soon as we got it going we were totally impressed!! Music sounds even better than expected!

Amazon is the only way to go when you need to purchase that product you’re looking for at a great price. Shipping is very quick and your product is packaged for protection.  Products work as advertised and meets or exceeds my expectations. Highly recommend Echo Smart Speaker!!!

I must say this is an excellent product. The sound and quality are superb! I would definitely buy more if I had a larger place. You can sync up anything on Amazon/Alexa/even bluetooth! The ability also to see what it would look like in your place was very very helpful!

Best Christmas gift I've gotten in years!.  Love the convenience of finding information.  Especially like listening to music.  Never expected the great sound quality.  Like the responsiveness to my voice even at a distance.  Will definitely purchase as gift for others.

The sound on this thing surprised me for its size. I keep the volume between 5-7 out of 10 max, and that's loud and clear enough to fill my medium-sized living roon. Alexa works great, and no complaints there. It would've been nice if it had an internal rechargeable battery, but also makes sense to keep it in your house plugged in the whole time.

It works as expected; excellent sound quality so it's great for a room speaker. I was able to pair it with my FireTv stick and can use it as a remote for my Amazon Prime Video service.  Looking forward to pairing it with more bluetooth devices as a controller.

Sounds quality is good. But I purchased so I can link them as is self described for the Echo. Stereo sounds basically. Well that worked, but if you are using Bluetooth to listen to music from your phone, it does not play on both Echo’s in stereo. It only plays on one. That needs to be redesigned.

Does not seem to respond as quickly as the Echo Plus. It also seems a bit “less than” in overall sound quality. I’d gotten it, so I could sink audio with my Echo Plus and that’s been a struggle. Still a great piece of equipment, just outshined by the Echo Plus.

It was a beautiful gift from a dear friend.  I love Alexa! I'm retired military and it  plays reveille in the morning and retreat in the evening and lastly the Star Spangled Banner.. I understand Alexa is a product from the United States Air Force. Thank you Alexa!

Nothing is perfect really, but this is a pretty cool device. It actually does a lot more than I really thought. I got it as a gift for my husband who is super techie. It has a lot of cool features that we plan to take advantage of. I suggest putting it on its own network just so that it's more secure.

I love the Alexa; I bought it while it was on sale for Black Friday and it was definitely worth the money. It's the only thing that actually helps me wake up in the morning and get out of bed! It's great for daily reminders which can be set up through the Alexa app. It plays all the music I ask it to and is even able to be linked with my Spotify account (and others but I don't use other ones). Occasionally it misinterprets what I say but it's good for nearly everything it promises!

This is our third echo. We got it for our 5 year old for her birthday and she loves it!  The speaker is good and allows her to play music in her room. She also likes asking Alexa questions. Sometimes we link them all together to have music all over the house.

Alexa is new to us. We couldn’t believe what great sound it gives us and how easy it is to use. Very impressed. So much so - that we got a second echo dot for our kitchen, a larger echo for the living room, an echo show 5” for our bedroom and an echo auto.

Been using a dot for a couple years. This is a huge improvement obviously. But it’s also much better than the 2nd generation echo that my roomies use. Sound is good and a fine replacement for my old bluetooth speaker. Wish it had a built in battery though.

Super disappointed! We upgraded our original Amazon Tap for the Echo. I was after a few of the features like drop-in and better sound BUT then I went to go grab Echo and bring her outside as I often do with my Tap and it DOESN'T WORK!!! I guess it has to be plugged in?!? I am SO SO disappointed.

This is my first Echo / Alexa unit. I found it easy to use and easy to install. The unit has broad capability and it seems that virtually all of the Smart Technology are scrambling  to get on the “Alexa Band Wagon” causing wider versatility in its ability.

There is absolutely NOTHING not to love about this echo. We use it allllll the time. For reminders. Lists. Music. Questions. Even calling my contacts in my phone. There's so much. Alexa has definitely made things easier for us. I recommend it to everyone.

I have been a prime member for a good 3-4 years now and i’m just now starting to get into the Echo ecosystem. I recently visited a friends house with a SONOS system and was very impressed with the quality/immersion and how you can play music throughout the entire house. However, I did NOT want to spend upwards of a GRAND on a couple speakers. The Echo speakers are not only a fraction of what a SONOS system would cost, but they provide MORE features than the SONOS. Thanks Amazon you’ve done it again. Very happy with these smart speakers. It’s even better with the Echo Sub! ;)

Using it mainly as a music system even though I know it can do much more. My favorite thing about it is if I have a song in my mnd, I can ask Alexa and hear the song immediately,  in most cases. Sometimes you have to be subscribed to their premium music service to hear a certain song.
It doesn’t work as well as the one that I got previously, the sounds is not as good, I have to make more then one request of the same command. I’m not as happy with it as the one I got years ago.

My daughter bought this for me in case I fall I can ask her to call my son that lives close.  She is very helpful for anything I ask for, the temps,  the weather,  or I set her to remind me of something.  I really like it. She will also play music for me.

Sounds pretty good.  I am looking forward to getting a Studio some time.  There was a bit of base rumble, but I put a few felt pads on the bottom and all is well.  I still prefer the volume ring, but I guess that I will get over it sometime.  I do like the size better than version 1.

The wifi does not seem to connect through our wifi extenders so we're unable to use this throughout the house but it works well within the area it does connect to wifi.  Not sure why it won't connect trough our wifi extenders since other electronics do.

Was late to join the personal assistant craze but so glad I did. In addition to playing a variety of music that I might not otherwise listen to, she now turns on my tv, my home surveillance cameras, opens/closes my driveway gate and raises and lowers my thermostat from the comforts of my bed or couch.

This 3rd gen does not recognize my voice as well as Gen 1. In same exact location. Same most common command, "Open NPR". I wind up screaming at it. The bass audio is better, and it's cuter than than my former black tower. I bought it on sale. Not sure I can recommend this generation. May be a lemon.

The Echo is easy to set up and use. I started using it with Amazon Music, which comes with Amazon Prime, that I have not had the chance to use until now. Now I don't know how I could have lived without Echo for so long. Perfect Christmas gift for myself. Love it.

This technology will continue to evolve and become easier to customize.  I use it mostly to play SiriusXM in the house without the need for a second subscription or equipment.  Every now and then Alexa doesn't quite understand some request, but nothing major.  You can't expect it to know much past its programming.

I had an earlier Alexa product that I loved.  Once it was uncharged I could unplug it and carry it around the house with me.  I used it for music and news, mostly, as well as occasional info queries.  I am disappointed with this new Echo.  It has much better sound quality than the old one.  But it is bulky and heavy and does not have a battery.  So I find myself rarely using it.  When I do unplug it and carry it to a new outlet, it takes too long to charge up and become responsive.  I will need to get a battery attachment, but that will only add more bulk & weight -- and cost!

Nice color choices, and I like the new size/form-factor as well. I have one of each gen, including the dots, and this has the best sound in my opinion. It has less fullness than the Sonos One I also have, but still nice in a small-to-mid sized room.

I really like the echo 3rd gen. The speaker sounds a little weaker than a BOSE I have. You also have to pay for prime music if you want to listen to a bigger playlist of the artist you're trying to listen to. Other than that I really like the purchase i made.

Alexa was exactly as described.  The sound quality is outstanding.  I've already created Playlists, Reminders and directions, i.e., "Alexa, turn off the Living Room Lights".  Alexa is fabulous.  I don't know how I did without her for so long.  I'm still expanding her capabilities.

Music sounds much better than the echo dot.  You can actually hear the base notes and the sound doesn't break up much at all.  I do hear more distortion on the echo dot.  We have this in the kitchen and the carries very well throughout the first floor.  I gave it 4 stars since I am looking for even better sound.  Would need a bigger system for that.

This echo has a nice sound , the bass is not so punchy but is not bad either, I have a sony xb31 and the sound is pretty similar,  obviously sony is better. My knly complaint is the bluetooth huh is hard to make it work everytime that i need it
I cant get it to connect. I also have google home and it took 60 seconds to download the app, connect to bluetooth, and use. I've been trying with thisnalwxa for 30 minutes and all it does is load.

I like very much the Alexa Echo (3ª generación), it sounds good, it recognizes the voice and it is of quality, but I understand that it is not of easy use, it only works with Wifi connection in both devices (App Alexa Mobile and Alexa) and it only must be used plugged, I had to resort to a battery to use it without being plugged. I give you a good evaluation because independently of those details that I mention it is a good speaker.

I ordered a smart plug for the introductory price of $.99 to try it out.  As I checked my Visa notification I saw that I was charged $75.95.  I immediately phoned Amazon to question the charge and was told Alexa had ordered four of the smart plugs.  I told the Amazon operator that I had ordered only one smart plug for $.99, he said that there was an error in the voice communication.  I asked him to amend my order to just the introductory smart plug and adjust the total, but he replied that he was unable to.  Either it was a scam or the voice identification needs refining.

This is our 5th Alexa product.  We are hooked!  I've also gifted Alexa devices to 5 different people.  Once you have it, you'll never know how you did without.  If you are concerned with security, turn off the microphone when you're not using it.

Great device but would like to hear better richer sound quality. Apple Home Pod still easily beats it in sound. If they can improve this with its growing array of smart features it will be amazing. Would also like to see everywhere play implemented if possible with all apps and not just a select few.

The sound quality is excellent and the Alexa function is great. However, there is one serious flaw of the echo. When playing music over Bluetooth, the volume is extremely low. It needs to turn all the way up to have a reasonable volume for music. But by then, the Alexa volume is way too loud. Sadly, there is no way to sync the volume level of the music and Alexa. Another minor glitch is when playing amazon music to stereo pair of echo, there is always a few seconds of noise before the music starts. It would be to mute them before the music starts.

I love the design and the look.  It's wider however but the sound is no match for the original 1st gen echo. I dropped my 1st gen echo 1 too many times and it broke so I ordered this one thinking I was upgrading... not better but will do the job

Well it might seem weird rating a product so highly but it is very impressive. The bass on the echo is amazing and the sound of music and Alexa is so clear and perfect. And the smart plug it came with made me so happy I got 3 more. So now I say Alexa turn off bedroom light while lying in bed. Ahhh makes things weird when I go to my parents, I almost tell Alexa to turn off the lights but there isn’t one lol. Anyway I soon got an echo dot in the living room to pair in the app so I can turn off and on my living room and bedroom lights. And having all Amazon products streamlines everything.

Super impressed by the sound. Deep bass, and clear highs and lows. Louder doesn't muddle any sound quality. Having BT connectivity issues with my iPad from the system settings. It doesn’t pick it up even though the iPad is recognized on the Alexa app. Only plays through app even though iPad is updated.

Definitely an upgrade in sound quality from my Echo first generation. I was expecting a little more low end from the speaker, but it's not bad. Also does not respond as easily as Gen one, so I have to speak louder, but not bad at all. I love the look and ease to set up. Currently considering the Echo Studio.

I received this as a gift.  My partner works opposite shift and it's nice to have something to ask questions, the weather, different word games, when the house gets too quiet.  setting timers for food and alarms is easy and speaking the words.  I enjoy a interesting fact, daily when I say good morning.

The new Echo has a much deeper and richer sound than the original Echo.  It was very easy to connect with my WiFi  We switched from black to twilight Blue and prefer the new look.  Very happy.  What I would like to see is for the App to be more user friendly and intuitive.

Lots of bugs connection issues running a pair in stereo.  Sometimes songs stop in the middle to start another one.  Other times one speaker keeps playing and the other speaker start playing something else in the middle of a song.  I hope Amazon fixes this.

I’m liking the quality of the music so far. But, I’m trying out HD music at the same time. With this, I’m not sure if the music is simply louder or more distinct.  I paid $60.00 for this, it seems a fair price for the quality.  Don’t pay more.

Has a GREAT sound. Excellent for music now. Was able to pair a headset. I needed some tech support, called Amazon & was able to resolve my issue & also helped me pair a Bluetooth headset, which works great. I love the new Dolby 360 sound.

Forced to unplug to make certain not "overhearing" our conversations. While unplugged, the unit would suddenly "come alive" and the blue light appeared briefly, scaring us because of another report that these units can make an unauthorized call.

The brochure that came with the product was minimal at best. They could expand to tell the new owner exactly what Alexa can do.  Read a book, give a reminder. I keep finding new ways to use Alexa, but it would be a step ahead to publish uses.

The speaker works as described.  But, I unplug it when not in use.  I understand that it records your conversations.  And, you have no way to delete or access what it records.  Can we believe that little red button keeps it from recording us?

never thought i have one of the devices in my home, i now have 4 and the are great. they control my lights and outlets and my door locks and cameras, i even have one at my other house in Tennessee !!!! i like them and not had any issues ever.

The Smart Speaker "echo" is a big improvement over the Echo - hockey puck.  This product eliminates the need to depend on a blue tooth or another small speaker.  Yes, it does not deliver stereo sound, but sitting here on my desk it works well.

When I first got this item as a gift, I thought it was really cool.  A few days later, Alexa did not respond to my voice at all.  The lights came on but shut off immediately after I asked her to play some music.  Last night, I asked her to play a specific artist.  She stated that she could not unless I pay, but she could play something similar.  The entire hour she played something similar, the music was static, and came in and out.  Have called my son several times since he gave me the item as a gift.  He said he didn't know why the item would be acting up.  No longer amused by this item.

I have 2 of these at my house, I bought them so my mom can easily listen to music. Can’t for the life of me get the 2 to sync in 2 rooms. I have a lot of Amazon tec in my house and my girlfriend’s. Most of it set up easily, including 2 of the Fire TV DVRs.

The sound quality when combined with Amazon music is absolutely top shelf. I usually purchase bose speakers but I must say this is same as or greater than in quality! My advice is that after you buy it you go into the settings and tweet the bass up just a bit.

We got this for my mom for Christmas because she has vision problems and it was hard for her to see the time and with this she can ask her what time it is and any other information that she needs that she can’t really see to find out. She loves it she’s always asking it questions and playing music on it.

Paired with the sub and the plan is another Echo gen 3 for stereo. I bought these units to connect with my 4 K Fire Tv. They fail after hours of support help. Software upgrade is not helping. The sound with the sub is good for music but a soundbar can do that. Going to a new soundbar . Alexa fails to live up to its name.
This sound quality is solid and is exactly the improvements that were needed from previous generations.

Sound quality is very much improved over previous generations. The limited edition color is great and fits our kitchen better than the black. Overall, You know what Alexa can do. May as well have one that looks good to show off.

Impressive sound. Bought as Echo Dot replacements in 2 rooms. The old tinning and low volume of those Dots were killing me. These give much better bass and treble, seemingly better than my 2nd Gen Echos. However, if Amazon can't keep these things from randomly stopping my music streaming for no reason, I will be replacing all 7 with Google's home!!!! devices.

Overall, works fair most of the time. Ask this speaker a question and a speaker in a different part of the house answers. Volume level 1-3 is useless. I won't spend the money on this again to expand my coverage, I'll just get an echo dot.

Echo works pretty good with LG TV and Yamaha Stereo system. It out performs the functionality of the Google Home device by 1000%, even with Google Chrome HD device plugged into TV. I hope they are still working on interface to make it even better, i.e control all aspects of TV and Stereo control.

I bought the Amazon Studio as well as this gen 3 Echo. I had a dot and original gen1 echo. Let’s just say the studio is great but I think I’d take 2 gen3 echos in stereo. The echo has great balance and punch for a bedroom speaker. Couldn’t be happier.

They got rid of the top that turns to control volume and replaced it with buttons on the top....very inconvenient if you are trying to turn it down in dim lighting.  Yes I know you can talk and say ‘turn volume down’, but not with a sleeping baby in a bassinet feet away.

If you don't have an Alexa you're missing out. Shes super handy and great at reminding me about everything! She's also super helpful in the kitchen. She helps you with timers, conversions, recipe place holders, etc. She also plays great music anytime you ask her! I would say my most favorite feature is the Good Morning Alexa command that I set up. She turns on the lights and goes through a set of tasks that I made her do.

I recently decided to upgrade up from my echo dot and could not be more satisfied. The sound quality is great, the unity looks great on display, and is very responsive to voice. What surprised me the most is the amount of bass that this thing produces, I have never had to turn the volume over 5 (out of 10).

I loved my 1st gen echo but it had some miles on it. So I upgraded to the newest gen model. Issues I have been having are as follows: device gets stuck in between two commands and it locks up. Example on amazon music station if you say skip the device locks up and the status lights just spin. Also having issues with the sound. Songs come in muffled at times

Sound quality is much better. The form factor is more attractive . All the great functionality with more features added daily is great. Pair this device with AnyList for keeping lists for groceries and tasks across all your Apple devices

Looks cool in blue with white controls.  Overall very good sound, Base is good, you can "feel" as well as hear the power.  The voice command feature doesn't seem to pick up my voice as effectively as 2nd generation Echo does.  Doesn't seem to get my requests as accurately either.  Overall fun device though, with good sound.  It's been cool to "pair" the 2nd and 3rd gen Echo in different rooms in an "everything" group for sound that fills the house with great sounding background music.  Not to mention the endless other features and skills these devices have.

It's what he wants for outside in the garden during the summer. Ok, fine. Right now it's unplugged, mute and deaf. As it should be. Creepy af these things listening all the time. All. The. Time. No matter what they tell you this thing is collecting your info.

Given to my grandson for his room...’he plays music and games, he turns the lights on and off and loves the multiple sleep noises...loves it and it’s great for calling him downstairs when I have dinner ready or need the garbage taken out😏

this is the first time we have had alexa and we are so impressed, i used it for the scavenger hunt i made for valentines day for my wife, programming a skill so when my wife asked for her next letter (solving a cryptic puzzle) alexa gave it to her and congratulated her. my new hobby is programming her to say and do all sorts of unique things, thanks amazon

the sound is deep and rich for a single small speaker...the problem comes with the 'Voice Recognition'. It seems we are constantly repeating questions.  We have several Echo Dot's so its not our first experience with Alexa and her minions.

I am really enjoying my new Alexa. We have had to get used to each other because she is much more “computer responsive “ than Siri, which I was accustomed to. I wish she wasn’t so flat with her responses. You really have to learn to speak bluntly to her.

This speaker fills my den with sound.  I like that I just have to say: "Alexa, play XXXX from ZZZ" to get music.  It requires teaching the speaker "skills" (code for installing apps on it!), but other than that, not too bad.  I have only used it a couple of weeks, so I'm not sure of all it's "skills" yet.

I was given an Echo Dot for Christmas. I really loved the sound, but thought that I would step it up a notch and bought myself this 3rd Gen Echo. The sound is even better and fuller than the Dot, and is a perfect fit in my home office.

These are much better than the echo dot Great sound and easy to connect. This also has a much better sound than the Google Home which is one of the reasons I purchased it. Find music and Apple Music are skills and are easily used

Alexa sometimes glitches and has to reboot  if I ask her to many questions in a row or to change the music and volume etc. I usually just use it for music and reminders. I wish it would play music nonstop from the amazon alexa app but it doesnt. You got to link up other music apps or bluetooth to get that endless music until you stop it. This feature would be great sense I play music all night. Overall I love the sound quality and the look of it is luxurious. Theres alot of feature to discover with the echo so it is definitely a helpful device and encompasses the majority of what I want out of it.
Much better sound than my 1st generation Echo. Better looking device as well. Can’t beat the trade in of an old device to upgrade price.

I use my Echo 99% just for music so far...I was able to cancel one of my satellite accounts bc now I can play it thru Alexa. I like that I can set my station and then turn off the microphone for privacy. Overall I'm glad I went for the Echo

I enjoy this in my bedroom, and love that I can set alarms to music or set it to sleep.  I use it just to check weather, play music, or set timers.  Very happy with this, and while it's not stereo, it's much better sound than my Tap.

I set my Alexa to communicate in Spanish, but the knowledge base is limited or not understood properly. Alexa responda ok to basic commands, but when challenged with world geography or music other than stream media the response is ‘ no lo se’ or ‘ten go problemas’. ...

Quedé completamente perplejo hasta donde sabía era bueno porque ya amistades me lo habían recomendado hasta que lo compré ,sin duda un instrumento que a demás de útil es buena calidad en soporte,en sonido,fácil de usar,recomiendo este artefacto si para la utilidad del hogar es lo que buscas

I miss the volume ring (?) But other than that it's improved in almost every way. It feels sturdier (first gen Echo' exterior would flex when you just pick it up), sounds better, and always picks up my voice even when something's playing.

Like the form factor.  Like the sound.  Like the voice recognition.  Do not like the integration with Fire TV stick 4K.  Pairing as stereo pair wad simple and connecting with FTVS was easy but one speaker continually drops out requiring me to unplug and start the pairing process all over again.  Amazon needs to work on firmware to allow connection of as many speakers as desired to FTVS to create as many channels as desired.  Also need to be able to pair with Sonos 1 speakers simultaneously and seamlessly.

I like this more than I thought I would for spontaneous music and temperature checks. The sound quality is good. Complicated alexa questions don't give good results though- for instance score to a game never gets the correct result.

I have two Echo's in my house and I've recently found that every time I connect one of them to the Bluetooth on my Pixel 3XL phone, I get a beep, and then an announcement to tell me "Now Connected to Pixel 3XL. What's making this unbearable is that sometimes I fall asleep listening to sounds on Alexa via my phone. Frequently, at around 3 or 4am Alexa suddenly bellows out "Now Connected to Pixel 3XL" which is terrifying at 4am! From what I understand, there is no solution to this, but it needs to be fixed!

Love the 'new' Echo 3 Gen., the set up was so easy and quick. I purchased the Amazon Smart Plug so Alexa-Echo can turn the lamp on and off when I enter and leave my living room. The speaker sounds amazing! So happy with my purchase.
